        <div id="readme" class="Box-body readme blob js-code-block-container p-5 p-xl-6 gist-border-0">
    <article class="markdown-body entry-content container-lg" itemprop="text"><h1 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-m3-competition-time-series-analysis-ds-6373-project" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#m3-competition-time-series-analysis-ds-6373-project"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>M3 competition Time Series analysis (DS 6373 Project)</h1>
<p dir="auto">Katherine Lockard, David George, Tamas Toth
2022-12-03</p>
<h2 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-objective" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#objective"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>Objective</h2>
<ul dir="auto">
<li>Using the M3 Competition Dataset form Monash University to compare
ARMA / ARIMA type models to MLP based models using a subset of the
data. The comparison is based on the performance of each type of model
in forecasting Yearly, Quarterly and Monthly data using RMSE and SMAPE
metrics.</li>
</ul>
<h3 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-categories-used-in-this-analysis" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#categories-used-in-this-analysis"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>Categories used in this analysis:</h3>
<ul dir="auto">
<li>Demographic</li>
<li>Finance</li>
<li>Micro</li>
</ul>
<h2 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-methodology" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#methodology"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>Methodology</h2>
<ol dir="auto">
<li>Load and transform the data</li>
<li>Carry out Exploratory Data Analysis to better understand the data</li>
<li>Use auto.arima() function to identify ARIMA model orders.</li>
<li>Using the ARIMA model identified in the previous step to forecast
short-, mid- and long-term horizons.</li>
<li>Using a Rolling Window method we will make short-, mid- and
long-term forecasts with MLP() and auto.arima() for each time series
realization.</li>
<li>Calculate the Rolling Window RMSE and SMAPE for each Monthly,
Quarterly and Yearly realization.</li>
<li>Plot the results for easy comparison</li>
<li>Compute an ensemble RMSE and SMAPE performance of the models for
each period based on the predefined horizon in the data set. This
approach fits a model to each realization and make a forecast on the
same horizon. The forecast error relevant to each horizon is
calculated per fitted model then the mean is taken of these forecast
errors to outputs a single RMSE or SMAPE value that represents the
ensemble performance of the models on that particular horizon.</li>
<li>Conclusion</li>
</ol>
<h4 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-loading-the-necessary-r-libraries-for-the-analysis" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#loading-the-necessary-r-libraries-for-the-analysis"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>Loading the necessary R libraries for the analysis</h4>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-r notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="libraries = c('knitr', 'rmarkdown', 'nnfor', 'tseries', 'readxl', 'tswge', 'ggplot2', 'reshape2', 'data.table', 'dplyr')

# Install packages as needed
installed_packages = libraries %in% rownames(installed.packages())
if (any(installed_packages == FALSE)) {
  install.packages(libraries[!installed_packages])
}

# Packages loading
invisible(lapply(libraries, library, character.only = TRUE))"><pre><span class="pl-v">libraries</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> c(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>knitr<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>, <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>rmarkdown<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>, <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>nnfor<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>, <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>tseries<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>, <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>readxl<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>, <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>tswge<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>, <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>ggplot2<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>, <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>reshape2<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>, <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>data.table<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>, <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>dplyr<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>)

<span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span> Install packages as needed</span>
<span class="pl-v">installed_packages</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">libraries</span> <span class="pl-k">%in%</span> rownames(installed.packages())
<span class="pl-k">if</span> (any(<span class="pl-smi">installed_packages</span> <span class="pl-k">==</span> <span class="pl-c1">FALSE</span>)) {
  install.packages(<span class="pl-smi">libraries</span>[<span class="pl-k">!</span><span class="pl-smi">installed_packages</span>])
}

<h2 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-exploratory-data-analysis---demographic-data" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#exploratory-data-analysis---demographic-data"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>Exploratory Data Analysis - Demographic data</h2>
<p dir="auto">#####################################################################################</p>
<p dir="auto">There are three period in the data set for the Demography category:
Monthly, Quarterly and Yearly. Each period has varying number of
independent realizations identified by a unique ‘Series’ number. No
domain knowledge is available for the data set therefore modeling will
be carried out solely based on the characteristic of the data.</p>
<h3 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-eda-approach-for-the-demographic-category" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#eda-approach-for-the-demographic-category"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>EDA Approach for the Demographic category:</h3>
<ol dir="auto">
<li>Given that the combined data set contain 413 unique time series
realizations we randomly selected 5 of them to understand how
similar or different these data sets are from each other.</li>
<li>Plot the 5 random realizations and draw conclusion.</li>
<li>Identify potential seasonality in the realizations.</li>
</ol>
<h3 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-plot-5-sample-of-the-monthly-demographic-data" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#plot-5-sample-of-the-monthly-demographic-data"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>Plot 5 sample of the Monthly Demographic data</h3>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-r notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="# Plot the Monthly data
set.seed(329)
randint = sample(1:dim(MDM3)[1], 5, replace=F)
MRS = list()
for (r in randint) 
  {
  MRS[[r]] = MDM3[r,1:MDM3$N[r]+6]
  MRS[[r]] = ts(t(MRS[[r]]), frequency = 12)
  lag_max = MDM3$N[r]
  layout(matrix(c(1,1,2,3), 2, 2, byrow = TRUE))
  plot(MRS[[r]], ylab='Values', main = paste('Series:',MDM3$Series[r]))
  acf(MRS[[r]], lag.max = lag_max, main=paste('Series:',MDM3$Series[r]))
  parzen.wge(MRS[[r]])
}"><pre><span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span> Plot the Monthly data</span>
set.seed(<span class="pl-c1">329</span>)
<span class="pl-v">randint</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> sample(<span class="pl-c1">1</span><span class="pl-k">:</span>dim(<span class="pl-smi">MDM3</span>)[<span class="pl-c1">1</span>], <span class="pl-c1">5</span>, <span class="pl-v">replace</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">F</span>)
<span class="pl-v">MRS</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">list</span>()
<span class="pl-k">for</span> (<span class="pl-smi">r</span> <span class="pl-k">in</span> <span class="pl-smi">randint</span>) 
  {
  <span class="pl-smi">MRS</span>[[<span class="pl-smi">r</span>]] <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">MDM3</span>[<span class="pl-smi">r</span>,<span class="pl-c1">1</span><span class="pl-k">:</span><span class="pl-smi">MDM3</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">N</span>[<span class="pl-smi">r</span>]<span class="pl-k">+</span><span class="pl-c1">6</span>]
  <span class="pl-smi">MRS</span>[[<span class="pl-smi">r</span>]] <span class="pl-k">=</span> ts(t(<span class="pl-smi">MRS</span>[[<span class="pl-smi">r</span>]]), <span class="pl-v">frequency</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-c1">12</span>)
  <span class="pl-v">lag_max</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">MDM3</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">N</span>[<span class="pl-smi">r</span>]
  layout(<span class="pl-k">matrix</span>(c(<span class="pl-c1">1</span>,<span class="pl-c1">1</span>,<span class="pl-c1">2</span>,<span class="pl-c1">3</span>), <span class="pl-c1">2</span>, <span class="pl-c1">2</span>, <span class="pl-v">byrow</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-c1">TRUE</span>))
  plot(<span class="pl-smi">MRS</span>[[<span class="pl-smi">r</span>]], <span class="pl-v">ylab</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>Values<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>, <span class="pl-v">main</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> paste(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>Series:<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>,<span class="pl-smi">MDM3</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">Series</span>[<span class="pl-smi">r</span>]))
  acf(<span class="pl-smi">MRS</span>[[<span class="pl-smi">r</span>]], <span class="pl-v">lag.max</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">lag_max</span>, <span class="pl-v">main</span><span class="pl-k">=</span>paste(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>Series:<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>,<span class="pl-smi">MDM3</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">Series</span>[<span class="pl-smi">r</span>]))
  parzen.wge(<span class="pl-smi">MRS</span>[[<span class="pl-smi">r</span>]])
}</pre></div>
<p dir="auto"><a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="/ttoth76/arima_vs_mlp/blob/main/ds_6373_project_files/figure-gfm/EDA1-1.png"><img src="/ttoth76/arima_vs_mlp/raw/main/ds_6373_project_files/figure-gfm/EDA1-1.png" width="100%" style="max-width: 100%;"></a><a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="/ttoth76/arima_vs_mlp/blob/main/ds_6373_project_files/figure-gfm/EDA1-2.png"><img src="/ttoth76/arima_vs_mlp/raw/main/ds_6373_project_files/figure-gfm/EDA1-2.png" width="100%" style="max-width: 100%;"></a><a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="/ttoth76/arima_vs_mlp/blob/main/ds_6373_project_files/figure-gfm/EDA1-3.png"><img src="/ttoth76/arima_vs_mlp/raw/main/ds_6373_project_files/figure-gfm/EDA1-3.png" width="100%" style="max-width: 100%;"></a><a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="/ttoth76/arima_vs_mlp/blob/main/ds_6373_project_files/figure-gfm/EDA1-4.png"><img src="/ttoth76/arima_vs_mlp/raw/main/ds_6373_project_files/figure-gfm/EDA1-4.png" width="100%" style="max-width: 100%;"></a><a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="/ttoth76/arima_vs_mlp/blob/main/ds_6373_project_files/figure-gfm/EDA1-5.png"><img src="/ttoth76/arima_vs_mlp/raw/main/ds_6373_project_files/figure-gfm/EDA1-5.png" width="100%" style="max-width: 100%;"></a></p>
<h3 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-observations" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#observations"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>Observations:</h3>
<ul dir="auto">
<li>Five random samples taken from the monthly Demographic data set to
assess the characteristics of the different time series realizations.</li>
<li>The plots of the samples show strong wandering behavior, damped
sinusoidal curve and a peak at zero in the spectral density.</li>
<li>We can also observe pseudo cyclic behavior in some cases as well as
seasonality in others.</li>
<li>Some of these realizations are stationary some are not.</li>
<li>Judging by the ACF and Spectral density plots we can observe that the
monthly Demographic data set have different time series
characteristics therefore ARIMA, SARIMA and ARMA models will be fit to
the realizations as needed. Due to the large number of realizations
with different characteristics it would be impractical to identify and
fit a model to each realization manually, therefore auto.arima()
function will be used for model identification.</li>
<li>The yearly data set has an avg. 123 month (data points) per
realization ~10 years.</li>
</ul>
<h3 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-plot-5-sample-of-the-quarterly-demographic-data" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#plot-5-sample-of-the-quarterly-demographic-data"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>Plot 5 sample of the Quarterly Demographic data</h3>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-r notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="# Plot the Quarterly data
set.seed(329)
randint = sample(1:dim(QDM3)[1], 5, replace=F)
QRS = list()
for (r in randint) 
  {
  QRS[[r]] = QDM3[r,1:QDM3$N[r]+6]
  QRS[[r]] = ts(t(QRS[[r]]), frequency = 4)
  lag_max = QDM3$N[r]
  layout(matrix(c(1,1,2,3), 2, 2, byrow = TRUE))
  plot(QRS[[r]], ylab='Values', main = paste('Series:',QDM3$Series[r]))
  acf(QRS[[r]], lag.max = lag_max, main=paste('Series:',QDM3$Series[r]))
  parzen.wge(QRS[[r]])
}"><pre><span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span> Plot the Quarterly data</span>
set.seed(<span class="pl-c1">329</span>)
<span class="pl-v">randint</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> sample(<span class="pl-c1">1</span><span class="pl-k">:</span>dim(<span class="pl-smi">QDM3</span>)[<span class="pl-c1">1</span>], <span class="pl-c1">5</span>, <span class="pl-v">replace</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">F</span>)
<span class="pl-v">QRS</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">list</span>()
<span class="pl-k">for</span> (<span class="pl-smi">r</span> <span class="pl-k">in</span> <span class="pl-smi">randint</span>) 
  {
  <span class="pl-smi">QRS</span>[[<span class="pl-smi">r</span>]] <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">QDM3</span>[<span class="pl-smi">r</span>,<span class="pl-c1">1</span><span class="pl-k">:</span><span class="pl-smi">QDM3</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">N</span>[<span class="pl-smi">r</span>]<span class="pl-k">+</span><span class="pl-c1">6</span>]
  <span class="pl-smi">QRS</span>[[<span class="pl-smi">r</span>]] <span class="pl-k">=</span> ts(t(<span class="pl-smi">QRS</span>[[<span class="pl-smi">r</span>]]), <span class="pl-v">frequency</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-c1">4</span>)
  <span class="pl-v">lag_max</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">QDM3</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">N</span>[<span class="pl-smi">r</span>]
  layout(<span class="pl-k">matrix</span>(c(<span class="pl-c1">1</span>,<span class="pl-c1">1</span>,<span class="pl-c1">2</span>,<span class="pl-c1">3</span>), <span class="pl-c1">2</span>, <span class="pl-c1">2</span>, <span class="pl-v">byrow</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-c1">TRUE</span>))
  plot(<span class="pl-smi">QRS</span>[[<span class="pl-smi">r</span>]], <span class="pl-v">ylab</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>Values<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>, <span class="pl-v">main</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> paste(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>Series:<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>,<span class="pl-smi">QDM3</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">Series</span>[<span class="pl-smi">r</span>]))
  acf(<span class="pl-smi">QRS</span>[[<span class="pl-smi">r</span>]], <span class="pl-v">lag.max</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">lag_max</span>, <span class="pl-v">main</span><span class="pl-k">=</span>paste(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>Series:<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>,<span class="pl-smi">QDM3</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">Series</span>[<span class="pl-smi">r</span>]))
  parzen.wge(<span class="pl-smi">QRS</span>[[<span class="pl-smi">r</span>]])
}</pre></div>
<p dir="auto"><a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="/ttoth76/arima_vs_mlp/blob/main/ds_6373_project_files/figure-gfm/EDA2-1.png"><img src="/ttoth76/arima_vs_mlp/raw/main/ds_6373_project_files/figure-gfm/EDA2-1.png" width="100%" style="max-width: 100%;"></a><a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="/ttoth76/arima_vs_mlp/blob/main/ds_6373_project_files/figure-gfm/EDA2-2.png"><img src="/ttoth76/arima_vs_mlp/raw/main/ds_6373_project_files/figure-gfm/EDA2-2.png" width="100%" style="max-width: 100%;"></a><a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="/ttoth76/arima_vs_mlp/blob/main/ds_6373_project_files/figure-gfm/EDA2-3.png"><img src="/ttoth76/arima_vs_mlp/raw/main/ds_6373_project_files/figure-gfm/EDA2-3.png" width="100%" style="max-width: 100%;"></a><a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="/ttoth76/arima_vs_mlp/blob/main/ds_6373_project_files/figure-gfm/EDA2-4.png"><img src="/ttoth76/arima_vs_mlp/raw/main/ds_6373_project_files/figure-gfm/EDA2-4.png" width="100%" style="max-width: 100%;"></a><a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="/ttoth76/arima_vs_mlp/blob/main/ds_6373_project_files/figure-gfm/EDA2-5.png"><img src="/ttoth76/arima_vs_mlp/raw/main/ds_6373_project_files/figure-gfm/EDA2-5.png" width="100%" style="max-width: 100%;"></a></p>
<ul dir="auto">
<li>Quarterly data sample shows similar wandering and pseudo periodic
behavior to the monthly data.</li>
<li>These realizations have different characteristics as well therefore
models with estimated orders will be fit to each one of the
realizations.</li>
<li>The length of the realizations are shorter than it is of the monthly
data set.</li>
<li>The quarterly data set has an avg. 55 quarter (data points) per
realization ~14 years.</li>
</ul>
<h3 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-plot-5-sample-of-the-yearly-demographic-data" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#plot-5-sample-of-the-yearly-demographic-data"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>Plot 5 sample of the Yearly Demographic data</h3>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-r notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="# Plot the Yearly data
set.seed(329)
randint = sample(1:dim(YDM3)[1], 5, replace=F)
YRS = list()
for (r in randint) 
  {
  YRS[[r]] = YDM3[r,1:YDM3$N[r]+6]
  YRS[[r]] = ts(t(YRS[[r]]))
  lag_max = YDM3$N[r]
  layout(matrix(c(1,1,2,3), 2, 2, byrow = TRUE))
  plot(YRS[[r]], ylab='Values', main = paste('Series:',YDM3$Series[r]))
  acf(YRS[[r]], lag.max = lag_max, main=paste('Series:',YDM3$Series[r]))
  parzen.wge(YRS[[r]])
  }"><pre><span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span> Plot the Yearly data</span>
set.seed(<span class="pl-c1">329</span>)
<span class="pl-v">randint</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> sample(<span class="pl-c1">1</span><span class="pl-k">:</span>dim(<span class="pl-smi">YDM3</span>)[<span class="pl-c1">1</span>], <span class="pl-c1">5</span>, <span class="pl-v">replace</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">F</span>)
<span class="pl-v">YRS</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">list</span>()
<span class="pl-k">for</span> (<span class="pl-smi">r</span> <span class="pl-k">in</span> <span class="pl-smi">randint</span>) 
  {
  <span class="pl-smi">YRS</span>[[<span class="pl-smi">r</span>]] <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">YDM3</span>[<span class="pl-smi">r</span>,<span class="pl-c1">1</span><span class="pl-k">:</span><span class="pl-smi">YDM3</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">N</span>[<span class="pl-smi">r</span>]<span class="pl-k">+</span><span class="pl-c1">6</span>]
  <span class="pl-smi">YRS</span>[[<span class="pl-smi">r</span>]] <span class="pl-k">=</span> ts(t(<span class="pl-smi">YRS</span>[[<span class="pl-smi">r</span>]]))
  <span class="pl-v">lag_max</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">YDM3</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">N</span>[<span class="pl-smi">r</span>]
  layout(<span class="pl-k">matrix</span>(c(<span class="pl-c1">1</span>,<span class="pl-c1">1</span>,<span class="pl-c1">2</span>,<span class="pl-c1">3</span>), <span class="pl-c1">2</span>, <span class="pl-c1">2</span>, <span class="pl-v">byrow</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-c1">TRUE</span>))
  plot(<span class="pl-smi">YRS</span>[[<span class="pl-smi">r</span>]], <span class="pl-v">ylab</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>Values<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>, <span class="pl-v">main</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> paste(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>Series:<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>,<span class="pl-smi">YDM3</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">Series</span>[<span class="pl-smi">r</span>]))
  acf(<span class="pl-smi">YRS</span>[[<span class="pl-smi">r</span>]], <span class="pl-v">lag.max</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">lag_max</span>, <span class="pl-v">main</span><span class="pl-k">=</span>paste(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>Series:<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>,<span class="pl-smi">YDM3</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">Series</span>[<span class="pl-smi">r</span>]))
  parzen.wge(<span class="pl-smi">YRS</span>[[<span class="pl-smi">r</span>]])
  }</pre></div>
<p dir="auto"><a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="/ttoth76/arima_vs_mlp/blob/main/ds_6373_project_files/figure-gfm/EDA3-1.png"><img src="/ttoth76/arima_vs_mlp/raw/main/ds_6373_project_files/figure-gfm/EDA3-1.png" width="100%" style="max-width: 100%;"></a><a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="/ttoth76/arima_vs_mlp/blob/main/ds_6373_project_files/figure-gfm/EDA3-2.png"><img src="/ttoth76/arima_vs_mlp/raw/main/ds_6373_project_files/figure-gfm/EDA3-2.png" width="100%" style="max-width: 100%;"></a><a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="/ttoth76/arima_vs_mlp/blob/main/ds_6373_project_files/figure-gfm/EDA3-3.png"><img src="/ttoth76/arima_vs_mlp/raw/main/ds_6373_project_files/figure-gfm/EDA3-3.png" width="100%" style="max-width: 100%;"></a><a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="/ttoth76/arima_vs_mlp/blob/main/ds_6373_project_files/figure-gfm/EDA3-4.png"><img src="/ttoth76/arima_vs_mlp/raw/main/ds_6373_project_files/figure-gfm/EDA3-4.png" width="100%" style="max-width: 100%;"></a><a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="/ttoth76/arima_vs_mlp/blob/main/ds_6373_project_files/figure-gfm/EDA3-5.png"><img src="/ttoth76/arima_vs_mlp/raw/main/ds_6373_project_files/figure-gfm/EDA3-5.png" width="100%" style="max-width: 100%;"></a></p>
<ul dir="auto">
<li>The yearly data sample exhibits similar characteristics to the monthly
and quarterly data samples.</li>
<li>These realizations are also wandering, have damping sinusoidal auto
correlation function and peaks at frequency zero.</li>
<li>The yearly data set has an avg. 27 years (data points) per
realization.</li>
</ul>
<h3 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-analyze-monthly-seasonal-demographic-data" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#analyze-monthly-seasonal-demographic-data"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>Analyze Monthly Seasonal Demographic data</h3>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-r notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="# Example of a seasonal model
layout(matrix(c(1,1,2,3), 2, 2, byrow = TRUE))
plot(ts(t(MDM3[1,1:MDM3$N[1]+6]), frequency = 12), ylab='Values', main = paste('Series:',MDM3$Series[1]))
acf(ts(t(MDM3[1,1:MDM3$N[1]+6]), frequency = 12), lag.max = 140, main=paste('Series:',MDM3$Series[1]))
parzen.wge(ts(t(MDM3[1,1:MDM3$N[1]+6]), frequency = 12))"><pre><span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span> Example of a seasonal model</span>
layout(<span class="pl-k">matrix</span>(c(<span class="pl-c1">1</span>,<span class="pl-c1">1</span>,<span class="pl-c1">2</span>,<span class="pl-c1">3</span>), <span class="pl-c1">2</span>, <span class="pl-c1">2</span>, <span class="pl-v">byrow</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-c1">TRUE</span>))
plot(ts(t(<span class="pl-smi">MDM3</span>[<span class="pl-c1">1</span>,<span class="pl-c1">1</span><span class="pl-k">:</span><span class="pl-smi">MDM3</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">N</span>[<span class="pl-c1">1</span>]<span class="pl-k">+</span><span class="pl-c1">6</span>]), <span class="pl-v">frequency</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-c1">12</span>), <span class="pl-v">ylab</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>Values<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>, <span class="pl-v">main</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> paste(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>Series:<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>,<span class="pl-smi">MDM3</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">Series</span>[<span class="pl-c1">1</span>]))
acf(ts(t(<span class="pl-smi">MDM3</span>[<span class="pl-c1">1</span>,<span class="pl-c1">1</span><span class="pl-k">:</span><span class="pl-smi">MDM3</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">N</span>[<span class="pl-c1">1</span>]<span class="pl-k">+</span><span class="pl-c1">6</span>]), <span class="pl-v">frequency</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-c1">12</span>), <span class="pl-v">lag.max</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-c1">140</span>, <span class="pl-v">main</span><span class="pl-k">=</span>paste(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>Series:<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>,<span class="pl-smi">MDM3</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">Series</span>[<span class="pl-c1">1</span>]))
parzen.wge(ts(t(<span class="pl-smi">MDM3</span>[<span class="pl-c1">1</span>,<span class="pl-c1">1</span><span class="pl-k">:</span><span class="pl-smi">MDM3</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">N</span>[<span class="pl-c1">1</span>]<span class="pl-k">+</span><span class="pl-c1">6</span>]), <span class="pl-v">frequency</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-c1">12</span>))</pre></div>
<p dir="auto"><a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="/ttoth76/arima_vs_mlp/blob/main/ds_6373_project_files/figure-gfm/Seasonal-analysis-1.png"><img src="/ttoth76/arima_vs_mlp/raw/main/ds_6373_project_files/figure-gfm/Seasonal-analysis-1.png" width="100%" style="max-width: 100%;"></a></p>
<ul dir="auto">
<li>Very similar realization to the Airline data. We can observe strong
wandering, upward trending, damping sinusoidal and cyclic behavior.</li>
<li>The spectral density plot has peaks at 0 and 0.25.</li>
<li>Clearly this is a non-stationary, seasonal data therefore let’s take
the first order difference and see if the seasonality is more
pronounced in the ACF plot.</li>
</ul>
<h3 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-time-series-after-first-order-differencing-of-the-data-d1" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#time-series-after-first-order-differencing-of-the-data-d1"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>Time Series after first order differencing of the data (d=1)</h3>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-r notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="diff1 = artrans.wge(ts(t(MDM3[1,1:MDM3$N[1]+6]), frequency = 12), phi.tr = 1, lag.max = 140)"><pre><span class="pl-v">diff1</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> artrans.wge(ts(t(<span class="pl-smi">MDM3</span>[<span class="pl-c1">1</span>,<span class="pl-c1">1</span><span class="pl-k">:</span><span class="pl-smi">MDM3</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">N</span>[<span class="pl-c1">1</span>]<span class="pl-k">+</span><span class="pl-c1">6</span>]), <span class="pl-v">frequency</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-c1">12</span>), <span class="pl-v">phi.tr</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-c1">1</span>, <span class="pl-v">lag.max</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-c1">140</span>)</pre></div>
<p dir="auto"><a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="/ttoth76/arima_vs_mlp/blob/main/ds_6373_project_files/figure-gfm/First-Difference-1.png"><img src="/ttoth76/arima_vs_mlp/raw/main/ds_6373_project_files/figure-gfm/First-Difference-1.png" alt="" style="max-width: 100%;"></a></p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-r notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="layout(matrix(c(1,1,2,3), 2, 2, byrow = TRUE))
plot(ts(diff1), ylab='Values', main = paste('Series:',MDM3$Series[1]))
acf(ts(diff1), lag.max = 140, main=paste('Series:',MDM3$Series[1]))
parzen.wge(ts(diff1))"><pre>layout(<span class="pl-k">matrix</span>(c(<span class="pl-c1">1</span>,<span class="pl-c1">1</span>,<span class="pl-c1">2</span>,<span class="pl-c1">3</span>), <span class="pl-c1">2</span>, <span class="pl-c1">2</span>, <span class="pl-v">byrow</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-c1">TRUE</span>))
plot(ts(<span class="pl-smi">diff1</span>), <span class="pl-v">ylab</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>Values<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>, <span class="pl-v">main</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> paste(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>Series:<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>,<span class="pl-smi">MDM3</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">Series</span>[<span class="pl-c1">1</span>]))
acf(ts(<span class="pl-smi">diff1</span>), <span class="pl-v">lag.max</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-c1">140</span>, <span class="pl-v">main</span><span class="pl-k">=</span>paste(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>Series:<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>,<span class="pl-smi">MDM3</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">Series</span>[<span class="pl-c1">1</span>]))
parzen.wge(ts(<span class="pl-smi">diff1</span>))</pre></div>
<p dir="auto"><a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="/ttoth76/arima_vs_mlp/blob/main/ds_6373_project_files/figure-gfm/plot-first-difference-1.png"><img src="/ttoth76/arima_vs_mlp/raw/main/ds_6373_project_files/figure-gfm/plot-first-difference-1.png" width="100%" style="max-width: 100%;"></a></p>
<h3 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-model-identification-of-the-same-seasonal-data-using-autoarima-function" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#model-identification-of-the-same-seasonal-data-using-autoarima-function"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>Model identification of the same seasonal data using auto.arima() function</h3>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-r notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="seasonal_arima = forecast::auto.arima(ts(t(MDM3[1,1:MDM3$N[1]+6]), frequency = 12))
seasonal_arima"><pre><span class="pl-v">seasonal_arima</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-e">forecast</span><span class="pl-k">::</span>auto.arima(ts(t(<span class="pl-smi">MDM3</span>[<span class="pl-c1">1</span>,<span class="pl-c1">1</span><span class="pl-k">:</span><span class="pl-smi">MDM3</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">N</span>[<span class="pl-c1">1</span>]<span class="pl-k">+</span><span class="pl-c1">6</span>]), <span class="pl-v">frequency</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-c1">12</span>))
<span class="pl-smi">seasonal_arima</span></pre></div>
<div class="snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="## Series: ts(t(MDM3[1, 1:MDM3$N[1] + 6]), frequency = 12) 
## ARIMA(0,1,1)(0,1,1)[12] 
## 
## Coefficients:
##           ma1     sma1
##       -0.2443  -0.8619
## s.e.   0.0891   0.1551
## 
## sigma^2 = 263.8:  log likelihood = -519.36
## AIC=1044.73   AICc=1044.93   BIC=1053.14"><pre class="notranslate"><code>## Series: ts(t(MDM3[1, 1:MDM3$N[1] + 6]), frequency = 12) 
## ARIMA(0,1,1)(0,1,1)[12] 
## 
## Coefficients:
##           ma1     sma1
##       -0.2443  -0.8619
## s.e.   0.0891   0.1551
## 
## sigma^2 = 263.8:  log likelihood = -519.36
## AIC=1044.73   AICc=1044.93   BIC=1053.14
</code></pre></div>
<ul dir="auto">
<li>After taking the first order difference, we can see that that the
realization is not white noise and the ACF plot shows longer lags at
the multiples of 12. * The auto.arima() model identified this as a
ARIMA(0,1,1) with s = 12. This is inline with the frequency (.083)
shown on the Spectral Density plot.</li>
<li>Seasonal Analysis of Quarterly and Yearly data is similar but the
seasonal factor would be 4 and 1 reespectivley insead of 12 as it is
for the monthly time series.</li>
</ul>

<h3 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-function-for-symmetric-mean-absolute-percentage-error-smape" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#function-for-symmetric-mean-absolute-percentage-error-smape"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>Function for Symmetric Mean Absolute Percentage Error (SMAPE)</h3>
<p dir="auto">#####################################################################################</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-r notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="#' Symmetric Mean Absolute Percentage Error calculation function
#' 
#' @param a: vector or list of actual values
#' @param f: vector or list of forecast values
smape = function(a, f) { return (1/length(a) * sum(2*abs(f-a) / (abs(a)+abs(f))*100))} "><pre><span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span>' Symmetric Mean Absolute Percentage Error calculation function</span>
<span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span>' </span>
<span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span>' @param a: vector or list of actual values</span>
<span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span>' @param f: vector or list of forecast values</span>
<span class="pl-en">smape</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">function</span>(<span class="pl-smi">a</span>, <span class="pl-smi">f</span>) { <span class="pl-k">return</span> (<span class="pl-c1">1</span><span class="pl-k">/</span>length(<span class="pl-smi">a</span>) <span class="pl-k">*</span> sum(<span class="pl-c1">2</span><span class="pl-k">*</span>abs(<span class="pl-smi">f</span><span class="pl-k">-</span><span class="pl-smi">a</span>) <span class="pl-k">/</span> (abs(<span class="pl-smi">a</span>)<span class="pl-k">+</span>abs(<span class="pl-smi">f</span>))<span class="pl-k">*</span><span class="pl-c1">100</span>))} </pre></div>
<p dir="auto">Created this function to calculate the Symmetric Mean Absolute
Percentage Error for each forecast. This metric is the preferred metric
of the M3 study as it is based on percentage error.</p>
<p dir="auto">#####################################################################################</p>
<h3 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-arima-rolling-windows-function-with-step-horizon" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#arima-rolling-windows-function-with-step-horizon"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>ARIMA Rolling Windows function with step HORIZON</h3>
<p dir="auto">#####################################################################################</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-r notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="#' Rolling Window function for ARIMA model estimation
#' This function allows the estimation of multiple ARIMA/ARMA models and makes forecast using a Rolling Windows method. This function also calculates RMSE and SMAPE metrics for time series forecasting. 
#' The function returns a data frame with RMSE and SMAPE values for each horizon values.
#' @param t_series: the Time Series realization
#' @param first_rel: it is an integer indicating the first realization in the list to start with (e.g if you have a total of 438 realization this number will tell what realization to count from up to 438). It creates a range where the lower bound will be this parameter and the upper is the original length of the series. This parameter is implemented to help with subsampling the data reduce computation time. 
#' @param f: frequency of the time series
#' @param horizon: single or list of horizon values to use for forecasting e.g. horizon=4 or horizon=c(2, 5, 10) 

roll.win.auto_arima = function(t_series, first_rel, f, horizon)
  {
  
  if (missing(horizon)){horizon = (1:t_series$NF[1])}
    else {horizon = horizon}
  
  if (missing(first_rel)){first_rel = 1:nrow(t_series)}
    else {first_rel = first_rel:nrow(t_series)}
  
  l = length(first_rel)
  lh = length(horizon)
  
  RMSE_ARIMA = list()
  SMAPE_ARIMA = list()
  series = list()
  seasonal = 0
  empty_matrix = matrix(ncol = 0, nrow =l)
  arima_df = data.frame(empty_matrix)
  
  for (step_h in horizon) {
    #print(paste(&quot;============================== Computing horizon:&quot;, step_h, '=============================='))
    for (i in first_rel) {
      series[[i]] = t_series[i, 1:t_series$N[i]+6]
      series[[i]] = ts(t(series[[i]]), start=c(t_series$`Starting Year`[i], t_series$`Starting Month`[i]), frequency = f)
      horizon = step_h
     
      trainingSize = floor(length(series[[i]])*0.5)+1
      numwindows = length(series[[i]]) - (trainingSize + horizon) +  1
      
      RMSEHolder = numeric(numwindows)
      SMAPEHolder = numeric(numwindows)
      
      set.seed(329)
      fit.m3.arima = forecast::auto.arima(ts(series[[i]][1:(1+(trainingSize-1))], frequency = f))
      
      if ((fit.m3.arima$arma[5] &gt; 0) &amp; (fit.m3.arima$arma[7] &gt; 0)) {
        s=fit.m3.arima$arma[5]
        #print(paste('Processing series:', i, ' out of ', dim(t_series)[1], &quot; with window size: &quot;,numwindows, &quot; - &quot;, t_series$Series[i] , &quot; is seasonal.&quot;))
        seasonal = seasonal + 1
        }
      else {
        s=fit.m3.arima$arma[7]
        #print(paste('Processing series:', i, ' out of ', dim(t_series)[1], &quot; with window size: &quot;,numwindows))
        }
      
      for(k in 1:numwindows)
      {
        set.seed(329)
        fit.m3.arima.k = forecast::Arima(ts(series[[i]][k:(k+(trainingSize-1))], frequency = f), model = fit.m3.arima)
        
        forecast.m3.arima = forecast(fit.m3.arima.k, h=horizon)
        
        RMSE = sqrt(mean((series[[i]][(trainingSize+k):(trainingSize+k + (horizon) - 1)] - forecast.m3.arima$mean)^2))
        SMAPE = smape(series[[i]][(trainingSize+k):(trainingSize+k + (horizon) - 1)], forecast.m3.arima$mean)
        
        RMSEHolder[k] = RMSE
        SMAPEHolder[k] = SMAPE
      }
      
      RMSE_ARIMA[i] = mean(RMSEHolder)
      SMAPE_ARIMA[i] = mean(SMAPEHolder)
    
    }
  
  rmse_to_df = list(RMSE_ARIMA[sapply(RMSE_ARIMA, function(x) length(x) == 0 )==FALSE])
  smape_to_df = list(SMAPE_ARIMA[sapply(SMAPE_ARIMA, function(x) length(x) == 0 )==FALSE])
  
  arima_df[paste('RMSE',toString(step_h), sep = &quot;_&quot;)] = rmse_to_df
  arima_df[paste('SMAPE',toString(step_h), sep = &quot;_&quot;)] = smape_to_df
  seasonal = seasonal / lh
  }
return(list(seasonal_count = seasonal, dataframe = arima_df))
}"><pre><span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span>' Rolling Window function for ARIMA model estimation</span>
<span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span>' This function allows the estimation of multiple ARIMA/ARMA models and makes forecast using a Rolling Windows method. This function also calculates RMSE and SMAPE metrics for time series forecasting. </span>
<span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span>' The function returns a data frame with RMSE and SMAPE values for each horizon values.</span>
<span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span>' @param t_series: the Time Series realization</span>
<span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span>' @param first_rel: it is an integer indicating the first realization in the list to start with (e.g if you have a total of 438 realization this number will tell what realization to count from up to 438). It creates a range where the lower bound will be this parameter and the upper is the original length of the series. This parameter is implemented to help with subsampling the data reduce computation time. </span>
<span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span>' @param f: frequency of the time series</span>

<span class="pl-en">roll.win.auto_arima</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">function</span>(<span class="pl-smi">t_series</span>, <span class="pl-smi">first_rel</span>, <span class="pl-smi">f</span>, <span class="pl-smi">horizon</span>)
  {

    <span class="pl-k">else</span> {<span class="pl-v">horizon</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">horizon</span>}
  
  <span class="pl-k">if</span> (missing(<span class="pl-smi">first_rel</span>)){<span class="pl-v">first_rel</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-c1">1</span><span class="pl-k">:</span>nrow(<span class="pl-smi">t_series</span>)}
    <span class="pl-k">else</span> {<span class="pl-v">first_rel</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">first_rel</span><span class="pl-k">:</span>nrow(<span class="pl-smi">t_series</span>)}
  
  <span class="pl-v">l</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> length(<span class="pl-smi">first_rel</span>)
  <span class="pl-v">lh</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> length(<span class="pl-smi">horizon</span>)
  
  <span class="pl-v">RMSE_ARIMA</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">list</span>()
  <span class="pl-v">SMAPE_ARIMA</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">list</span>()
  <span class="pl-v">series</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">list</span>()
  <span class="pl-v">seasonal</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-c1">0</span>
  <span class="pl-v">empty_matrix</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">matrix</span>(<span class="pl-v">ncol</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-c1">0</span>, <span class="pl-v">nrow</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-smi">l</span>)
  <span class="pl-v">arima_df</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">data.frame</span>(<span class="pl-smi">empty_matrix</span>)
  
  <span class="pl-k">for</span> (<span class="pl-smi">step_h</span> <span class="pl-k">in</span> <span class="pl-smi">horizon</span>) {
    <span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span>print(paste("============================== Computing horizon:", step_h, '=============================='))</span>
    <span class="pl-k">for</span> (<span class="pl-smi">i</span> <span class="pl-k">in</span> <span class="pl-smi">first_rel</span>) {
      <span class="pl-smi">series</span>[[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>]] <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">t_series</span>[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>, <span class="pl-c1">1</span><span class="pl-k">:</span><span class="pl-smi">t_series</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">N</span>[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>]<span class="pl-k">+</span><span class="pl-c1">6</span>]
      <span class="pl-smi">series</span>[[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>]] <span class="pl-k">=</span> ts(t(<span class="pl-smi">series</span>[[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>]]), <span class="pl-v">start</span><span class="pl-k">=</span>c(<span class="pl-smi">t_series</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">`Starting Year`</span>[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>], <span class="pl-smi">t_series</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">`Starting Month`</span>[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>]), <span class="pl-v">frequency</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">f</span>)
      <span class="pl-v">horizon</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">step_h</span>
     
      <span class="pl-v">trainingSize</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> floor(length(<span class="pl-smi">series</span>[[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>]])<span class="pl-k">*</span><span class="pl-c1">0.5</span>)<span class="pl-k">+</span><span class="pl-c1">1</span>
      <span class="pl-v">numwindows</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> length(<span class="pl-smi">series</span>[[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>]]) <span class="pl-k">-</span> (<span class="pl-smi">trainingSize</span> <span class="pl-k">+</span> <span class="pl-smi">horizon</span>) <span class="pl-k">+</span>  <span class="pl-c1">1</span>
      
      <span class="pl-v">RMSEHolder</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">numeric</span>(<span class="pl-smi">numwindows</span>)
      <span class="pl-v">SMAPEHolder</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">numeric</span>(<span class="pl-smi">numwindows</span>)
      
      set.seed(<span class="pl-c1">329</span>)
      <span class="pl-v">fit.m3.arima</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-e">forecast</span><span class="pl-k">::</span>auto.arima(ts(<span class="pl-smi">series</span>[[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>]][<span class="pl-c1">1</span><span class="pl-k">:</span>(<span class="pl-c1">1</span><span class="pl-k">+</span>(<span class="pl-smi">trainingSize</span><span class="pl-k">-</span><span class="pl-c1">1</span>))], <span class="pl-v">frequency</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">f</span>))
      
      <span class="pl-k">if</span> ((<span class="pl-smi">fit.m3.arima</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">arma</span>[<span class="pl-c1">5</span>] <span class="pl-k">&gt;</span> <span class="pl-c1">0</span>) <span class="pl-k">&amp;</span> (<span class="pl-smi">fit.m3.arima</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">arma</span>[<span class="pl-c1">7</span>] <span class="pl-k">&gt;</span> <span class="pl-c1">0</span>)) {
        <span class="pl-v">s</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-smi">fit.m3.arima</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">arma</span>[<span class="pl-c1">5</span>]

        <span class="pl-v">seasonal</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">seasonal</span> <span class="pl-k">+</span> <span class="pl-c1">1</span>
        }

        <span class="pl-v">s</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-smi">fit.m3.arima</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">arma</span>[<span class="pl-c1">7</span>]
        <span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span>print(paste('Processing series:', i, ' out of ', dim(t_series)[1], " with window size: ",numwindows))</span>
        }
      
      <span class="pl-k">for</span>(<span class="pl-smi">k</span> <span class="pl-k">in</span> <span class="pl-c1">1</span><span class="pl-k">:</span><span class="pl-smi">numwindows</span>)
      {
        set.seed(<span class="pl-c1">329</span>)
        <span class="pl-v">fit.m3.arima.k</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-e">forecast</span><span class="pl-k">::</span>Arima(ts(<span class="pl-smi">series</span>[[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>]][<span class="pl-smi">k</span><span class="pl-k">:</span>(<span class="pl-smi">k</span><span class="pl-k">+</span>(<span class="pl-smi">trainingSize</span><span class="pl-k">-</span><span class="pl-c1">1</span>))], <span class="pl-v">frequency</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">f</span>), <span class="pl-v">model</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">fit.m3.arima</span>)
        
        <span class="pl-v">forecast.m3.arima</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> forecast(<span class="pl-smi">fit.m3.arima.k</span>, <span class="pl-v">h</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-smi">horizon</span>)
        
        <span class="pl-v">RMSE</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> sqrt(mean((<span class="pl-smi">series</span>[[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>]][(<span class="pl-smi">trainingSize</span><span class="pl-k">+</span><span class="pl-smi">k</span>)<span class="pl-k">:</span>(<span class="pl-smi">trainingSize</span><span class="pl-k">+</span><span class="pl-smi">k</span> <span class="pl-k">+</span> (<span class="pl-smi">horizon</span>) <span class="pl-k">-</span> <span class="pl-c1">1</span>)] <span class="pl-k">-</span> <span class="pl-smi">forecast.m3.arima</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">mean</span>)<span class="pl-k">^</span><span class="pl-c1">2</span>))
        <span class="pl-v">SMAPE</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> smape(<span class="pl-smi">series</span>[[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>]][(<span class="pl-smi">trainingSize</span><span class="pl-k">+</span><span class="pl-smi">k</span>)<span class="pl-k">:</span>(<span class="pl-smi">trainingSize</span><span class="pl-k">+</span><span class="pl-smi">k</span> <span class="pl-k">+</span> (<span class="pl-smi">horizon</span>) <span class="pl-k">-</span> <span class="pl-c1">1</span>)], <span class="pl-smi">forecast.m3.arima</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">mean</span>)
        
        <span class="pl-smi">RMSEHolder</span>[<span class="pl-smi">k</span>] <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">RMSE</span>
        <span class="pl-smi">SMAPEHolder</span>[<span class="pl-smi">k</span>] <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">SMAPE</span>
      }
      
      <span class="pl-smi">RMSE_ARIMA</span>[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>] <span class="pl-k">=</span> mean(<span class="pl-smi">RMSEHolder</span>)
      <span class="pl-smi">SMAPE_ARIMA</span>[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>] <span class="pl-k">=</span> mean(<span class="pl-smi">SMAPEHolder</span>)
    
    }
  
  <span class="pl-v">rmse_to_df</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">list</span>(<span class="pl-smi">RMSE_ARIMA</span>[sapply(<span class="pl-smi">RMSE_ARIMA</span>, <span class="pl-k">function</span>(<span class="pl-smi">x</span>) length(<span class="pl-smi">x</span>) <span class="pl-k">==</span> <span class="pl-c1">0</span> )<span class="pl-k">==</span><span class="pl-c1">FALSE</span>])
  <span class="pl-v">smape_to_df</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">list</span>(<span class="pl-smi">SMAPE_ARIMA</span>[sapply(<span class="pl-smi">SMAPE_ARIMA</span>, <span class="pl-k">function</span>(<span class="pl-smi">x</span>) length(<span class="pl-smi">x</span>) <span class="pl-k">==</span> <span class="pl-c1">0</span> )<span class="pl-k">==</span><span class="pl-c1">FALSE</span>])
  
  <span class="pl-smi">arima_df</span>[paste(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>RMSE<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>,toString(<span class="pl-smi">step_h</span>), <span class="pl-v">sep</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>_<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>)] <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">rmse_to_df</span>
  <span class="pl-smi">arima_df</span>[paste(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>SMAPE<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>,toString(<span class="pl-smi">step_h</span>), <span class="pl-v">sep</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>_<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>)] <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">smape_to_df</span>
  <span class="pl-v">seasonal</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">seasonal</span> <span class="pl-k">/</span> <span class="pl-smi">lh</span>
  }
<span class="pl-k">return</span>(<span class="pl-k">list</span>(<span class="pl-v">seasonal_count</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">seasonal</span>, <span class="pl-v">dataframe</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">arima_df</span>))
}</pre></div>

<h3 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-arima-ensemble-function-with-step-horizon" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#arima-ensemble-function-with-step-horizon"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>ARIMA Ensemble function with step HORIZON</h3>
<p dir="auto">#####################################################################################</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-r notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="#' Ensemble function for ARIMA model estimation
#' This function allows the estimation of multiple ARIMA/ARMA models using a one-horizon-increment calculation. This function also calculates RMSE and SMAPE metrics for time series forecasting. The horizon range always starts from 1 and the upper bound of the range is derived from the data set NF column. The function will step through the horizon range by an increment of 1. 
#' The function returns a data frame with RMSE and SMAPE values for each horizon values.
#' @param t_series: the Time Series realization

ensemble.auto_arima = function(t_series, f)
{
  set.seed(329)
  series = list()
  RMSE_mean = list()
  SMAPE_mean = list()
  
  trainingSize = list()
  horizon_orig = (t_series$NF[1]) 
  
  first_rel = 1:nrow(t_series)
  l = length(first_rel)
  empty_matrix = matrix(ncol = 0, nrow = 1)
  arima_df = data.frame(empty_matrix)
  
  for (hs in 1:horizon_orig) { 
    horizon = hs  
    RMSEHolder.h = numeric()
    SMAPEHolder.h = numeric()
    
    #print(paste('Please wait calculating RMSE &amp; SMAPE for ARIMA with different Horizion size: ', hs))
    
    for (i in 1:nrow(t_series)) {
      series[[i]] = t_series[i, 1:t_series$N[i]+6]
      series[[i]] = ts(t(series[[i]]), start=c(t_series$`Starting Year`[i], t_series$`Starting Month`[i]), frequency = f)
      series_end = (t_series$N[i]) - horizon
      trainingSize[[i]] = ts(series[[i]][1:series_end], frequency = f)
      
      # Fit the model
      set.seed(329)
      arima_model.h = forecast::auto.arima(trainingSize[[i]])
          
      # Forecast based on the given horizon
      forecasts.arima.h = forecast(arima_model.h, h=horizon)
      
      # Calculate RMSE metrics
      RMSE = sqrt(mean((series[[i]][(series_end+1):(series_end+horizon)] - forecasts.arima.h$mean)^2))
      RMSEHolder.h[i] = RMSE
      
      # Calculate SMAPE metrics
      SMAPE = smape(series[[i]][(series_end+1):(series_end+horizon)], forecasts.arima.h$mean)
      SMAPEHolder.h[i] = unlist(SMAPE)
    }
    
  RMSE_mean[hs] = mean(RMSEHolder.h)
  SMAPE_mean[hs] = mean(SMAPEHolder.h)

  arima_df[paste('RMSE',toString(hs), sep = &quot;_&quot;)] = RMSE_mean[hs]
  arima_df[paste('SMAPE',toString(hs), sep = &quot;_&quot;)] = SMAPE_mean[hs]  
  }
 return(dataframe = arima_df)
}"><pre><span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span>' Ensemble function for ARIMA model estimation</span>
<span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span>' This function allows the estimation of multiple ARIMA/ARMA models using a one-horizon-increment calculation. This function also calculates RMSE and SMAPE metrics for time series forecasting. The horizon range always starts from 1 and the upper bound of the range is derived from the data set NF column. The function will step through the horizon range by an increment of 1. </span>
<span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span>' The function returns a data frame with RMSE and SMAPE values for each horizon values.</span>
<span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span>' @param t_series: the Time Series realization</span>

<span class="pl-en">ensemble.auto_arima</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">function</span>(<span class="pl-smi">t_series</span>, <span class="pl-smi">f</span>)
{
  set.seed(<span class="pl-c1">329</span>)
  <span class="pl-v">series</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">list</span>()
  <span class="pl-v">RMSE_mean</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">list</span>()
  <span class="pl-v">SMAPE_mean</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">list</span>()
  
  <span class="pl-v">trainingSize</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">list</span>()
  <span class="pl-v">horizon_orig</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> (<span class="pl-smi">t_series</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">NF</span>[<span class="pl-c1">1</span>]) 
  
  <span class="pl-v">first_rel</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-c1">1</span><span class="pl-k">:</span>nrow(<span class="pl-smi">t_series</span>)
  <span class="pl-v">l</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> length(<span class="pl-smi">first_rel</span>)
  <span class="pl-v">empty_matrix</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">matrix</span>(<span class="pl-v">ncol</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-c1">0</span>, <span class="pl-v">nrow</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-c1">1</span>)
  <span class="pl-v">arima_df</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">data.frame</span>(<span class="pl-smi">empty_matrix</span>)
  
  <span class="pl-k">for</span> (<span class="pl-smi">hs</span> <span class="pl-k">in</span> <span class="pl-c1">1</span><span class="pl-k">:</span><span class="pl-smi">horizon_orig</span>) { 
    <span class="pl-v">horizon</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">hs</span>  
    <span class="pl-v">RMSEHolder.h</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">numeric</span>()
    <span class="pl-v">SMAPEHolder.h</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">numeric</span>()
    
    <span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span>print(paste('Please wait calculating RMSE &amp; SMAPE for ARIMA with different Horizion size: ', hs))</span>
    
    <span class="pl-k">for</span> (<span class="pl-smi">i</span> <span class="pl-k">in</span> <span class="pl-c1">1</span><span class="pl-k">:</span>nrow(<span class="pl-smi">t_series</span>)) {
      <span class="pl-smi">series</span>[[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>]] <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">t_series</span>[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>, <span class="pl-c1">1</span><span class="pl-k">:</span><span class="pl-smi">t_series</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">N</span>[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>]<span class="pl-k">+</span><span class="pl-c1">6</span>]
      <span class="pl-smi">series</span>[[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>]] <span class="pl-k">=</span> ts(t(<span class="pl-smi">series</span>[[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>]]), <span class="pl-v">start</span><span class="pl-k">=</span>c(<span class="pl-smi">t_series</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">`Starting Year`</span>[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>], <span class="pl-smi">t_series</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">`Starting Month`</span>[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>]), <span class="pl-v">frequency</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">f</span>)
      <span class="pl-v">series_end</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> (<span class="pl-smi">t_series</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">N</span>[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>]) <span class="pl-k">-</span> <span class="pl-smi">horizon</span>
      <span class="pl-smi">trainingSize</span>[[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>]] <span class="pl-k">=</span> ts(<span class="pl-smi">series</span>[[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>]][<span class="pl-c1">1</span><span class="pl-k">:</span><span class="pl-smi">series_end</span>], <span class="pl-v">frequency</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">f</span>)
      
      <span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span> Fit the model</span>
      set.seed(<span class="pl-c1">329</span>)
      <span class="pl-v">arima_model.h</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-e">forecast</span><span class="pl-k">::</span>auto.arima(<span class="pl-smi">trainingSize</span>[[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>]])
          
      <span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span> Forecast based on the given horizon</span>
      <span class="pl-v">forecasts.arima.h</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> forecast(<span class="pl-smi">arima_model.h</span>, <span class="pl-v">h</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-smi">horizon</span>)
      
      <span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span> Calculate RMSE metrics</span>
      <span class="pl-v">RMSE</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> sqrt(mean((<span class="pl-smi">series</span>[[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>]][(<span class="pl-smi">series_end</span><span class="pl-k">+</span><span class="pl-c1">1</span>)<span class="pl-k">:</span>(<span class="pl-smi">series_end</span><span class="pl-k">+</span><span class="pl-smi">horizon</span>)] <span class="pl-k">-</span> <span class="pl-smi">forecasts.arima.h</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">mean</span>)<span class="pl-k">^</span><span class="pl-c1">2</span>))
      <span class="pl-smi">RMSEHolder.h</span>[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>] <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">RMSE</span>
      
      <span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span> Calculate SMAPE metrics</span>
      <span class="pl-v">SMAPE</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> smape(<span class="pl-smi">series</span>[[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>]][(<span class="pl-smi">series_end</span><span class="pl-k">+</span><span class="pl-c1">1</span>)<span class="pl-k">:</span>(<span class="pl-smi">series_end</span><span class="pl-k">+</span><span class="pl-smi">horizon</span>)], <span class="pl-smi">forecasts.arima.h</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">mean</span>)
      <span class="pl-smi">SMAPEHolder.h</span>[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>] <span class="pl-k">=</span> unlist(<span class="pl-smi">SMAPE</span>)
    }
    
  <span class="pl-smi">RMSE_mean</span>[<span class="pl-smi">hs</span>] <span class="pl-k">=</span> mean(<span class="pl-smi">RMSEHolder.h</span>)
  <span class="pl-smi">SMAPE_mean</span>[<span class="pl-smi">hs</span>] <span class="pl-k">=</span> mean(<span class="pl-smi">SMAPEHolder.h</span>)

  <span class="pl-smi">arima_df</span>[paste(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>RMSE<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>,toString(<span class="pl-smi">hs</span>), <span class="pl-v">sep</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>_<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>)] <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">RMSE_mean</span>[<span class="pl-smi">hs</span>]
  <span class="pl-smi">arima_df</span>[paste(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>SMAPE<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>,toString(<span class="pl-smi">hs</span>), <span class="pl-v">sep</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>_<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>)] <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">SMAPE_mean</span>[<span class="pl-smi">hs</span>]  
  }
 <span class="pl-k">return</span>(<span class="pl-v">dataframe</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">arima_df</span>)
}</pre></div>
