<h3 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-arima-wo-rolling-windows-function-with-step-horizon" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#arima-wo-rolling-windows-function-with-step-horizon"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>ARIMA w/o Rolling Windows function with step HORIZON</h3>
<p dir="auto">#####################################################################################</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-r notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="#' This function estimates ARIMA models without using rolling window for forecast.
#' This function allows the estimation of multiple ARIMA/ARMA models. This function also calculates RMSE and SMAPE metrics for time series forecasting. 
#' The function returns a data frame with RMSE and SMAPE values for each horizon values.
#' @param t_series: the Time Series realization
#' @param first_rel: it is an integer indicating the first realization in the list to start with (e.g if you have a total of 438 realization this number will tell what realization to count from up to 438)
#' @param f: frequency of the time series
#' @param horizon: single or list of horizon values to use for forecasting e.g. horizon=4 or horizon=c(2, 5, 10) 

horizon.auto_arima = function(t_series, f, first_rel, horizon)
{
  
   if (missing(horizon)){horizon = (1:t_series$NF[1])}
    else {horizon = horizon}
  
  if (missing(first_rel)){first_rel = 1:nrow(t_series)}
    else {first_rel = first_rel:nrow(t_series)}
  
  l = length(first_rel)
  lh = length(horizon)
  
  series = list()
  
  RMSEHolder = numeric(length(first_rel))
  SMAPEHolder = numeric(length(first_rel))
  
  empty_matrix = matrix(ncol = 0, nrow =l)
  arima_df = data.frame(empty_matrix)
  
  for (step_h in horizon) {
      #print(paste(&quot;============================== Computing horizon:&quot;, step_h, '=============================='))
      for (i in first_rel) {
        
        series[[i]] = t_series[i, 1:t_series$N[i]+6]
        series[[i]] = ts(t(series[[i]]), start=c(t_series$`Starting Year`[i], t_series$`Starting Month`[i]), frequency = f)
        horizon = step_h
        
        trainingSize = length(series[[i]])-horizon
        
        set.seed(329)  
        #print(paste('Processing series:', i, ' out of ', dim(t_series)[1]))
        
        fit.m3.arima = forecast::auto.arima(ts(series[[i]][1:trainingSize], frequency = f))
        forecast.m3.arima = forecast(fit.m3.arima, h=horizon)
        
        RMSE = sqrt(mean((series[[i]][(trainingSize+1):(trainingSize+horizon)] - forecast.m3.arima$mean)^2))
        SMAPE = smape(series[[i]][(trainingSize+1):(trainingSize+horizon)], forecast.m3.arima$mean)
        
        RMSEHolder[i] = RMSE
        SMAPEHolder[i] = SMAPE
      }
  
      rmse_to_df = list(RMSEHolder[sapply(RMSEHolder, function(x) length(x) == 0 )==FALSE])
      smape_to_df = list(SMAPEHolder[sapply(SMAPEHolder, function(x) length(x) == 0 )==FALSE])
      
        
      arima_df[paste('RMSE',toString(step_h), sep = &quot;_&quot;)] = rmse_to_df
      arima_df[paste('SMAPE',toString(step_h), sep = &quot;_&quot;)] = smape_to_df  
      }
    return(dataframe = arima_df)
}"><pre><span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span>' This function estimates ARIMA models without using rolling window for forecast.</span>
<span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span>' This function allows the estimation of multiple ARIMA/ARMA models. This function also calculates RMSE and SMAPE metrics for time series forecasting. </span>
<span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span>' The function returns a data frame with RMSE and SMAPE values for each horizon values.</span>
<span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span>' @param t_series: the Time Series realization</span>
<span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span>' @param first_rel: it is an integer indicating the first realization in the list to start with (e.g if you have a total of 438 realization this number will tell what realization to count from up to 438)</span>
<span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span>' @param f: frequency of the time series</span>
<span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span>' @param horizon: single or list of horizon values to use for forecasting e.g. horizon=4 or horizon=c(2, 5, 10) </span>

<span class="pl-en">horizon.auto_arima</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">function</span>(<span class="pl-smi">t_series</span>, <span class="pl-smi">f</span>, <span class="pl-smi">first_rel</span>, <span class="pl-smi">horizon</span>)
{
  
   <span class="pl-k">if</span> (missing(<span class="pl-smi">horizon</span>)){<span class="pl-v">horizon</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> (<span class="pl-c1">1</span><span class="pl-k">:</span><span class="pl-smi">t_series</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">NF</span>[<span class="pl-c1">1</span>])}
    <span class="pl-k">else</span> {<span class="pl-v">horizon</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">horizon</span>}
  
  <span class="pl-k">if</span> (missing(<span class="pl-smi">first_rel</span>)){<span class="pl-v">first_rel</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-c1">1</span><span class="pl-k">:</span>nrow(<span class="pl-smi">t_series</span>)}
    <span class="pl-k">else</span> {<span class="pl-v">first_rel</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">first_rel</span><span class="pl-k">:</span>nrow(<span class="pl-smi">t_series</span>)}
  
  <span class="pl-v">l</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> length(<span class="pl-smi">first_rel</span>)
  <span class="pl-v">lh</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> length(<span class="pl-smi">horizon</span>)
  
  <span class="pl-v">series</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">list</span>()
  
  <span class="pl-v">RMSEHolder</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">numeric</span>(length(<span class="pl-smi">first_rel</span>))
  <span class="pl-v">SMAPEHolder</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">numeric</span>(length(<span class="pl-smi">first_rel</span>))
  
  <span class="pl-v">empty_matrix</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">matrix</span>(<span class="pl-v">ncol</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-c1">0</span>, <span class="pl-v">nrow</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-smi">l</span>)
  <span class="pl-v">arima_df</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">data.frame</span>(<span class="pl-smi">empty_matrix</span>)
  
  <span class="pl-k">for</span> (<span class="pl-smi">step_h</span> <span class="pl-k">in</span> <span class="pl-smi">horizon</span>) {
      <span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span>print(paste("============================== Computing horizon:", step_h, '=============================='))</span>
      <span class="pl-k">for</span> (<span class="pl-smi">i</span> <span class="pl-k">in</span> <span class="pl-smi">first_rel</span>) {
        
        <span class="pl-smi">series</span>[[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>]] <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">t_series</span>[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>, <span class="pl-c1">1</span><span class="pl-k">:</span><span class="pl-smi">t_series</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">N</span>[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>]<span class="pl-k">+</span><span class="pl-c1">6</span>]
        <span class="pl-smi">series</span>[[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>]] <span class="pl-k">=</span> ts(t(<span class="pl-smi">series</span>[[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>]]), <span class="pl-v">start</span><span class="pl-k">=</span>c(<span class="pl-smi">t_series</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">`Starting Year`</span>[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>], <span class="pl-smi">t_series</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">`Starting Month`</span>[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>]), <span class="pl-v">frequency</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">f</span>)
        <span class="pl-v">horizon</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">step_h</span>
        
        <span class="pl-v">trainingSize</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> length(<span class="pl-smi">series</span>[[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>]])<span class="pl-k">-</span><span class="pl-smi">horizon</span>
        
        set.seed(<span class="pl-c1">329</span>)  
        <span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span>print(paste('Processing series:', i, ' out of ', dim(t_series)[1]))</span>
        
        <span class="pl-v">fit.m3.arima</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-e">forecast</span><span class="pl-k">::</span>auto.arima(ts(<span class="pl-smi">series</span>[[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>]][<span class="pl-c1">1</span><span class="pl-k">:</span><span class="pl-smi">trainingSize</span>], <span class="pl-v">frequency</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">f</span>))
        <span class="pl-v">forecast.m3.arima</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> forecast(<span class="pl-smi">fit.m3.arima</span>, <span class="pl-v">h</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-smi">horizon</span>)
        
        <span class="pl-v">RMSE</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> sqrt(mean((<span class="pl-smi">series</span>[[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>]][(<span class="pl-smi">trainingSize</span><span class="pl-k">+</span><span class="pl-c1">1</span>)<span class="pl-k">:</span>(<span class="pl-smi">trainingSize</span><span class="pl-k">+</span><span class="pl-smi">horizon</span>)] <span class="pl-k">-</span> <span class="pl-smi">forecast.m3.arima</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">mean</span>)<span class="pl-k">^</span><span class="pl-c1">2</span>))
        <span class="pl-v">SMAPE</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> smape(<span class="pl-smi">series</span>[[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>]][(<span class="pl-smi">trainingSize</span><span class="pl-k">+</span><span class="pl-c1">1</span>)<span class="pl-k">:</span>(<span class="pl-smi">trainingSize</span><span class="pl-k">+</span><span class="pl-smi">horizon</span>)], <span class="pl-smi">forecast.m3.arima</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">mean</span>)
        
        <span class="pl-smi">RMSEHolder</span>[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>] <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">RMSE</span>
        <span class="pl-smi">SMAPEHolder</span>[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>] <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">SMAPE</span>
      }
  
      <span class="pl-v">rmse_to_df</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">list</span>(<span class="pl-smi">RMSEHolder</span>[sapply(<span class="pl-smi">RMSEHolder</span>, <span class="pl-k">function</span>(<span class="pl-smi">x</span>) length(<span class="pl-smi">x</span>) <span class="pl-k">==</span> <span class="pl-c1">0</span> )<span class="pl-k">==</span><span class="pl-c1">FALSE</span>])
      <span class="pl-v">smape_to_df</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">list</span>(<span class="pl-smi">SMAPEHolder</span>[sapply(<span class="pl-smi">SMAPEHolder</span>, <span class="pl-k">function</span>(<span class="pl-smi">x</span>) length(<span class="pl-smi">x</span>) <span class="pl-k">==</span> <span class="pl-c1">0</span> )<span class="pl-k">==</span><span class="pl-c1">FALSE</span>])
      
        
      <span class="pl-smi">arima_df</span>[paste(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>RMSE<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>,toString(<span class="pl-smi">step_h</span>), <span class="pl-v">sep</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>_<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>)] <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">rmse_to_df</span>
      <span class="pl-smi">arima_df</span>[paste(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>SMAPE<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>,toString(<span class="pl-smi">step_h</span>), <span class="pl-v">sep</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>_<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>)] <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">smape_to_df</span>  
      }
    <span class="pl-k">return</span>(<span class="pl-v">dataframe</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">arima_df</span>)
}</pre></div>

<h3 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-mlp-rolling-windows-function-with-step-horizon" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#mlp-rolling-windows-function-with-step-horizon"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>MLP Rolling Windows function with step HORIZON</h3>
<p dir="auto">#####################################################################################</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-r notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="#' Rolling Window function for MLP model estimation
#' This function allows the estimation of multiple MLP models and makes forecast using a Rolling Windows method. This function also calculates RMSE and SMAPE metrics for time series forecasting. 
#' The function returns a data frame with RMSE and SMAPE values for each horizon values.
#' @param t_series: the Time Series realization
#' @param first_rel: it is an integer indicating the first realization in the list to start with (e.g if you have a total of 438 realization this number will tell what realization to count from up to 438). It creates a range where the lower bound will be this parameter and the upper is the original length of the series. This parameter is implemented to help with subsampling the data reduce computation time. 
#' @param f: frequency of the time series
#' @param horizon: single or list of horizon values to use for forecasting e.g. horizon=4 or horizon=c(2, 5, 10) 

roll.win.mlp = function(t_series, f, first_rel, horizon)
{
  
   if (missing(horizon)){horizon = (1:t_series$NF[1])}
    else {horizon = horizon}
  
  if (missing(first_rel)){first_rel = 1:nrow(t_series)}
    else {first_rel = first_rel:nrow(t_series)}
  
  l = length(first_rel)
  lh = length(horizon)
  
  series = list()
  RMSE_MLP = list()
  SMAPE_MLP = list()
  InSampleMSE = list()
  
  empty_matrix = matrix(ncol = 0, nrow =l)
  mlp_df = data.frame(empty_matrix)
  
  for (step_h in horizon) {
      #print(paste(&quot;============================== Computing horizon:&quot;, step_h, '=============================='))
      for (i in first_rel) {
        
        series[[i]] = t_series[i, 1:t_series$N[i]+6]
        series[[i]] = ts(t(series[[i]]), start=c(t_series$`Starting Year`[i], t_series$`Starting Month`[i]), frequency = f)
        horizon = step_h
        
        trainingSize = floor(length(series[[i]])*0.5)+1
        numwindows = length(series[[i]])-(trainingSize + horizon)+1
        
        RMSEHolder = numeric(numwindows)
        SMAPEHolder = numeric(numwindows)
        inSampleMSEHolder = numeric(numwindows)
        
        set.seed(329)  
        fit.m3.mlp = mlp(ts(series[[i]][1:(1+(trainingSize-1))], frequency = f),  reps = 20, comb = &quot;mean&quot;)
        
        #print(paste('Processing series:', i, ' out of ', dim(t_series)[1], &quot; with window size: &quot;,numwindows))
        
        for(k in 1:numwindows)
        {
          set.seed(329)
          fit.m3.mlp.k = mlp(ts(series[[i]][k:(k+(trainingSize-1))], frequency = f),  reps = 20, comb = &quot;mean&quot;, model = fit.m3.mlp, retrain = TRUE)
          forecast.m3.mlp = forecast(fit.m3.mlp.k, h=horizon)
          
          RMSE = sqrt(mean((series[[i]][(trainingSize+k):(trainingSize+k + (horizon)-1)] - forecast.m3.mlp$mean)^2))
          SMAPE = smape(series[[i]][(trainingSize+k):(trainingSize+k + (horizon)-1)], forecast.m3.mlp$mean)
          
          RMSEHolder[k] = RMSE
          SMAPEHolder[k] = SMAPE
          inSampleMSEHolder[k] = fit.m3.mlp.k$MSE
        }
        RMSE_MLP[i] = mean(RMSEHolder)
        SMAPE_MLP[i] = mean(SMAPEHolder)
        InSampleMSE[i] = mean(inSampleMSEHolder)
      }
      rmse_to_df = list(RMSE_MLP[sapply(RMSE_MLP, function(x) length(x) == 0 )==FALSE])
      smape_to_df = list(SMAPE_MLP[sapply(SMAPE_MLP, function(x) length(x) == 0 )==FALSE])
      InSampleMSE_df = list(InSampleMSE[sapply(InSampleMSE, function(x) length(x) == 0 )==FALSE])
        
      mlp_df[paste('RMSE',toString(step_h), sep = &quot;_&quot;)] = rmse_to_df
      mlp_df[paste('SMAPE',toString(step_h), sep = &quot;_&quot;)] = smape_to_df
  }
return (list(dataframe = mlp_df, InSampleMSE = InSampleMSE_df))
}"><pre><span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span>' Rolling Window function for MLP model estimation</span>
<span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span>' This function allows the estimation of multiple MLP models and makes forecast using a Rolling Windows method. This function also calculates RMSE and SMAPE metrics for time series forecasting. </span>
<span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span>' The function returns a data frame with RMSE and SMAPE values for each horizon values.</span>
<span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span>' @param t_series: the Time Series realization</span>
<span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span>' @param first_rel: it is an integer indicating the first realization in the list to start with (e.g if you have a total of 438 realization this number will tell what realization to count from up to 438). It creates a range where the lower bound will be this parameter and the upper is the original length of the series. This parameter is implemented to help with subsampling the data reduce computation time. </span>
<span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span>' @param f: frequency of the time series</span>
<span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span>' @param horizon: single or list of horizon values to use for forecasting e.g. horizon=4 or horizon=c(2, 5, 10) </span>

<span class="pl-en">roll.win.mlp</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">function</span>(<span class="pl-smi">t_series</span>, <span class="pl-smi">f</span>, <span class="pl-smi">first_rel</span>, <span class="pl-smi">horizon</span>)
{
  
   <span class="pl-k">if</span> (missing(<span class="pl-smi">horizon</span>)){<span class="pl-v">horizon</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> (<span class="pl-c1">1</span><span class="pl-k">:</span><span class="pl-smi">t_series</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">NF</span>[<span class="pl-c1">1</span>])}
    <span class="pl-k">else</span> {<span class="pl-v">horizon</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">horizon</span>}
  
  <span class="pl-k">if</span> (missing(<span class="pl-smi">first_rel</span>)){<span class="pl-v">first_rel</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-c1">1</span><span class="pl-k">:</span>nrow(<span class="pl-smi">t_series</span>)}
    <span class="pl-k">else</span> {<span class="pl-v">first_rel</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">first_rel</span><span class="pl-k">:</span>nrow(<span class="pl-smi">t_series</span>)}
  
  <span class="pl-v">l</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> length(<span class="pl-smi">first_rel</span>)
  <span class="pl-v">lh</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> length(<span class="pl-smi">horizon</span>)
  
  <span class="pl-v">series</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">list</span>()
  <span class="pl-v">RMSE_MLP</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">list</span>()
  <span class="pl-v">SMAPE_MLP</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">list</span>()
  <span class="pl-v">InSampleMSE</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">list</span>()
  
  <span class="pl-v">empty_matrix</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">matrix</span>(<span class="pl-v">ncol</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-c1">0</span>, <span class="pl-v">nrow</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-smi">l</span>)
  <span class="pl-v">mlp_df</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">data.frame</span>(<span class="pl-smi">empty_matrix</span>)
  
  <span class="pl-k">for</span> (<span class="pl-smi">step_h</span> <span class="pl-k">in</span> <span class="pl-smi">horizon</span>) {
      <span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span>print(paste("============================== Computing horizon:", step_h, '=============================='))</span>
      <span class="pl-k">for</span> (<span class="pl-smi">i</span> <span class="pl-k">in</span> <span class="pl-smi">first_rel</span>) {
        
        <span class="pl-smi">series</span>[[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>]] <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">t_series</span>[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>, <span class="pl-c1">1</span><span class="pl-k">:</span><span class="pl-smi">t_series</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">N</span>[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>]<span class="pl-k">+</span><span class="pl-c1">6</span>]
        <span class="pl-smi">series</span>[[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>]] <span class="pl-k">=</span> ts(t(<span class="pl-smi">series</span>[[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>]]), <span class="pl-v">start</span><span class="pl-k">=</span>c(<span class="pl-smi">t_series</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">`Starting Year`</span>[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>], <span class="pl-smi">t_series</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">`Starting Month`</span>[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>]), <span class="pl-v">frequency</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">f</span>)
        <span class="pl-v">horizon</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">step_h</span>
        
        <span class="pl-v">trainingSize</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> floor(length(<span class="pl-smi">series</span>[[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>]])<span class="pl-k">*</span><span class="pl-c1">0.5</span>)<span class="pl-k">+</span><span class="pl-c1">1</span>
        <span class="pl-v">numwindows</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> length(<span class="pl-smi">series</span>[[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>]])<span class="pl-k">-</span>(<span class="pl-smi">trainingSize</span> <span class="pl-k">+</span> <span class="pl-smi">horizon</span>)<span class="pl-k">+</span><span class="pl-c1">1</span>
        
        <span class="pl-v">RMSEHolder</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">numeric</span>(<span class="pl-smi">numwindows</span>)
        <span class="pl-v">SMAPEHolder</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">numeric</span>(<span class="pl-smi">numwindows</span>)
        <span class="pl-v">inSampleMSEHolder</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">numeric</span>(<span class="pl-smi">numwindows</span>)
        
        set.seed(<span class="pl-c1">329</span>)  
        <span class="pl-v">fit.m3.mlp</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> mlp(ts(<span class="pl-smi">series</span>[[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>]][<span class="pl-c1">1</span><span class="pl-k">:</span>(<span class="pl-c1">1</span><span class="pl-k">+</span>(<span class="pl-smi">trainingSize</span><span class="pl-k">-</span><span class="pl-c1">1</span>))], <span class="pl-v">frequency</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">f</span>),  <span class="pl-v">reps</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-c1">20</span>, <span class="pl-v">comb</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>mean<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>)
        
        <span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span>print(paste('Processing series:', i, ' out of ', dim(t_series)[1], " with window size: ",numwindows))</span>
        
        <span class="pl-k">for</span>(<span class="pl-smi">k</span> <span class="pl-k">in</span> <span class="pl-c1">1</span><span class="pl-k">:</span><span class="pl-smi">numwindows</span>)
        {
          set.seed(<span class="pl-c1">329</span>)
          <span class="pl-v">fit.m3.mlp.k</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> mlp(ts(<span class="pl-smi">series</span>[[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>]][<span class="pl-smi">k</span><span class="pl-k">:</span>(<span class="pl-smi">k</span><span class="pl-k">+</span>(<span class="pl-smi">trainingSize</span><span class="pl-k">-</span><span class="pl-c1">1</span>))], <span class="pl-v">frequency</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">f</span>),  <span class="pl-v">reps</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-c1">20</span>, <span class="pl-v">comb</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>mean<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, <span class="pl-v">model</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">fit.m3.mlp</span>, <span class="pl-v">retrain</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-c1">TRUE</span>)
          <span class="pl-v">forecast.m3.mlp</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> forecast(<span class="pl-smi">fit.m3.mlp.k</span>, <span class="pl-v">h</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-smi">horizon</span>)
          
          <span class="pl-v">RMSE</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> sqrt(mean((<span class="pl-smi">series</span>[[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>]][(<span class="pl-smi">trainingSize</span><span class="pl-k">+</span><span class="pl-smi">k</span>)<span class="pl-k">:</span>(<span class="pl-smi">trainingSize</span><span class="pl-k">+</span><span class="pl-smi">k</span> <span class="pl-k">+</span> (<span class="pl-smi">horizon</span>)<span class="pl-k">-</span><span class="pl-c1">1</span>)] <span class="pl-k">-</span> <span class="pl-smi">forecast.m3.mlp</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">mean</span>)<span class="pl-k">^</span><span class="pl-c1">2</span>))
          <span class="pl-v">SMAPE</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> smape(<span class="pl-smi">series</span>[[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>]][(<span class="pl-smi">trainingSize</span><span class="pl-k">+</span><span class="pl-smi">k</span>)<span class="pl-k">:</span>(<span class="pl-smi">trainingSize</span><span class="pl-k">+</span><span class="pl-smi">k</span> <span class="pl-k">+</span> (<span class="pl-smi">horizon</span>)<span class="pl-k">-</span><span class="pl-c1">1</span>)], <span class="pl-smi">forecast.m3.mlp</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">mean</span>)
          
          <span class="pl-smi">RMSEHolder</span>[<span class="pl-smi">k</span>] <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">RMSE</span>
          <span class="pl-smi">SMAPEHolder</span>[<span class="pl-smi">k</span>] <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">SMAPE</span>
          <span class="pl-smi">inSampleMSEHolder</span>[<span class="pl-smi">k</span>] <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">fit.m3.mlp.k</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">MSE</span>
        }
        <span class="pl-smi">RMSE_MLP</span>[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>] <span class="pl-k">=</span> mean(<span class="pl-smi">RMSEHolder</span>)
        <span class="pl-smi">SMAPE_MLP</span>[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>] <span class="pl-k">=</span> mean(<span class="pl-smi">SMAPEHolder</span>)
        <span class="pl-smi">InSampleMSE</span>[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>] <span class="pl-k">=</span> mean(<span class="pl-smi">inSampleMSEHolder</span>)
      }
      <span class="pl-v">rmse_to_df</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">list</span>(<span class="pl-smi">RMSE_MLP</span>[sapply(<span class="pl-smi">RMSE_MLP</span>, <span class="pl-k">function</span>(<span class="pl-smi">x</span>) length(<span class="pl-smi">x</span>) <span class="pl-k">==</span> <span class="pl-c1">0</span> )<span class="pl-k">==</span><span class="pl-c1">FALSE</span>])
      <span class="pl-v">smape_to_df</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">list</span>(<span class="pl-smi">SMAPE_MLP</span>[sapply(<span class="pl-smi">SMAPE_MLP</span>, <span class="pl-k">function</span>(<span class="pl-smi">x</span>) length(<span class="pl-smi">x</span>) <span class="pl-k">==</span> <span class="pl-c1">0</span> )<span class="pl-k">==</span><span class="pl-c1">FALSE</span>])
      <span class="pl-v">InSampleMSE_df</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">list</span>(<span class="pl-smi">InSampleMSE</span>[sapply(<span class="pl-smi">InSampleMSE</span>, <span class="pl-k">function</span>(<span class="pl-smi">x</span>) length(<span class="pl-smi">x</span>) <span class="pl-k">==</span> <span class="pl-c1">0</span> )<span class="pl-k">==</span><span class="pl-c1">FALSE</span>])
        
      <span class="pl-smi">mlp_df</span>[paste(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>RMSE<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>,toString(<span class="pl-smi">step_h</span>), <span class="pl-v">sep</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>_<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>)] <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">rmse_to_df</span>
      <span class="pl-smi">mlp_df</span>[paste(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>SMAPE<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>,toString(<span class="pl-smi">step_h</span>), <span class="pl-v">sep</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>_<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>)] <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">smape_to_df</span>
  }
<span class="pl-k">return</span> (<span class="pl-k">list</span>(<span class="pl-v">dataframe</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">mlp_df</span>, <span class="pl-v">InSampleMSE</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">InSampleMSE_df</span>))
}</pre></div>

<h3 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-ensemble-function-for-mlp-with-step-horizon" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#ensemble-function-for-mlp-with-step-horizon"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>Ensemble function for MLP with step HORIZON</h3>
<p dir="auto">#####################################################################################</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-r notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="#' Ensemble function for MLP model estimation
#' This function allows the estimation of multiple MLP models using a one-horizon-increment calculation. This function also calculates RMSE and SMAPE metrics for time series forecasting. The horizon range always starts from 1 and the upper bound of the range is derived from the data set NF column. The function will step through the horizon range by an increment of 1. 
#' The function returns a data frame with RMSE and SMAPE values for each horizon values.
#' @param t_series: the Time Series realization

ensemble.mlp = function(t_series, f)
{
  set.seed(329)
  series = list()
  RMSE_mean = list()
  SMAPE_mean = list()
  
  trainingSize = list()
  horizon_orig = (t_series$NF[1]) 
  
  empty_matrix = matrix(ncol = 0, nrow =1)
  mlp_df = data.frame(empty_matrix)

  for (hs in 1:horizon_orig) { 
    horizon = hs  
    RMSEHolder.h = numeric()
    SMAPEHolder.h = numeric()
    
    #print(paste('Please wait calculating RMSE &amp; SMAPE for MLP with different Horizion size: ', hs))
    
     for (i in 1:nrow(t_series)) {
      series[[i]] = t_series[i, 1:t_series$N[i]+6]
      series[[i]] = ts(t(series[[i]]), start=c(t_series$`Starting Year`[i], t_series$`Starting Month`[i]), frequency = f)
      series_end = (t_series$N[i]) - horizon
      trainingSize = series[[i]][1:(series_end)]
      
      # Fit the model
      set.seed(329)  
      fit.m3.mlp = mlp(ts(trainingSize, frequency = f),  reps = 20, comb = &quot;mean&quot;)
      forecast.m3.mlp = forecast(fit.m3.mlp, h=horizon)
      
      
      # Calculate RMSE metrics
      RMSE = sqrt(mean((series[[i]][series_end:series_end+horizon] - forecast.m3.mlp$mean)^2))
      RMSEHolder.h[i] = RMSE
      
      # Calculate SMAPE metrics
      SMAPE = smape(series[[i]][series_end:series_end+horizon], forecast.m3.mlp$mean)
      SMAPEHolder.h[i] = unlist(SMAPE)
    }
    
  RMSE_mean[hs] = mean(RMSEHolder.h)
  SMAPE_mean[hs] = mean(SMAPEHolder.h)
  
  mlp_df[paste('RMSE',toString(hs), sep = &quot;_&quot;)] = RMSE_mean[hs]
  mlp_df[paste('SMAPE',toString(hs), sep = &quot;_&quot;)] = SMAPE_mean[hs]  
  
}
return(dataframe = mlp_df)
}"><pre><span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span>' Ensemble function for MLP model estimation</span>
<span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span>' This function allows the estimation of multiple MLP models using a one-horizon-increment calculation. This function also calculates RMSE and SMAPE metrics for time series forecasting. The horizon range always starts from 1 and the upper bound of the range is derived from the data set NF column. The function will step through the horizon range by an increment of 1. </span>
<span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span>' The function returns a data frame with RMSE and SMAPE values for each horizon values.</span>
<span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span>' @param t_series: the Time Series realization</span>

<span class="pl-en">ensemble.mlp</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">function</span>(<span class="pl-smi">t_series</span>, <span class="pl-smi">f</span>)
{
  set.seed(<span class="pl-c1">329</span>)
  <span class="pl-v">series</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">list</span>()
  <span class="pl-v">RMSE_mean</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">list</span>()
  <span class="pl-v">SMAPE_mean</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">list</span>()
  
  <span class="pl-v">trainingSize</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">list</span>()
  <span class="pl-v">horizon_orig</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> (<span class="pl-smi">t_series</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">NF</span>[<span class="pl-c1">1</span>]) 
  
  <span class="pl-v">empty_matrix</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">matrix</span>(<span class="pl-v">ncol</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-c1">0</span>, <span class="pl-v">nrow</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">1</span>)
  <span class="pl-v">mlp_df</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">data.frame</span>(<span class="pl-smi">empty_matrix</span>)

  <span class="pl-k">for</span> (<span class="pl-smi">hs</span> <span class="pl-k">in</span> <span class="pl-c1">1</span><span class="pl-k">:</span><span class="pl-smi">horizon_orig</span>) { 
    <span class="pl-v">horizon</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">hs</span>  
    <span class="pl-v">RMSEHolder.h</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">numeric</span>()
    <span class="pl-v">SMAPEHolder.h</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">numeric</span>()
    
    <span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span>print(paste('Please wait calculating RMSE &amp; SMAPE for MLP with different Horizion size: ', hs))</span>
    
     <span class="pl-k">for</span> (<span class="pl-smi">i</span> <span class="pl-k">in</span> <span class="pl-c1">1</span><span class="pl-k">:</span>nrow(<span class="pl-smi">t_series</span>)) {
      <span class="pl-smi">series</span>[[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>]] <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">t_series</span>[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>, <span class="pl-c1">1</span><span class="pl-k">:</span><span class="pl-smi">t_series</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">N</span>[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>]<span class="pl-k">+</span><span class="pl-c1">6</span>]
      <span class="pl-smi">series</span>[[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>]] <span class="pl-k">=</span> ts(t(<span class="pl-smi">series</span>[[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>]]), <span class="pl-v">start</span><span class="pl-k">=</span>c(<span class="pl-smi">t_series</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">`Starting Year`</span>[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>], <span class="pl-smi">t_series</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">`Starting Month`</span>[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>]), <span class="pl-v">frequency</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">f</span>)
      <span class="pl-v">series_end</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> (<span class="pl-smi">t_series</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">N</span>[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>]) <span class="pl-k">-</span> <span class="pl-smi">horizon</span>
      <span class="pl-v">trainingSize</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">series</span>[[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>]][<span class="pl-c1">1</span><span class="pl-k">:</span>(<span class="pl-smi">series_end</span>)]
      
      <span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span> Fit the model</span>
      set.seed(<span class="pl-c1">329</span>)  
      <span class="pl-v">fit.m3.mlp</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> mlp(ts(<span class="pl-smi">trainingSize</span>, <span class="pl-v">frequency</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">f</span>),  <span class="pl-v">reps</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-c1">20</span>, <span class="pl-v">comb</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>mean<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>)
      <span class="pl-v">forecast.m3.mlp</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> forecast(<span class="pl-smi">fit.m3.mlp</span>, <span class="pl-v">h</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-smi">horizon</span>)
      
      
      <span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span> Calculate RMSE metrics</span>
      <span class="pl-v">RMSE</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> sqrt(mean((<span class="pl-smi">series</span>[[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>]][<span class="pl-smi">series_end</span><span class="pl-k">:</span><span class="pl-smi">series_end</span><span class="pl-k">+</span><span class="pl-smi">horizon</span>] <span class="pl-k">-</span> <span class="pl-smi">forecast.m3.mlp</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">mean</span>)<span class="pl-k">^</span><span class="pl-c1">2</span>))
      <span class="pl-smi">RMSEHolder.h</span>[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>] <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">RMSE</span>
      
      <span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span> Calculate SMAPE metrics</span>
      <span class="pl-v">SMAPE</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> smape(<span class="pl-smi">series</span>[[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>]][<span class="pl-smi">series_end</span><span class="pl-k">:</span><span class="pl-smi">series_end</span><span class="pl-k">+</span><span class="pl-smi">horizon</span>], <span class="pl-smi">forecast.m3.mlp</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">mean</span>)
      <span class="pl-smi">SMAPEHolder.h</span>[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>] <span class="pl-k">=</span> unlist(<span class="pl-smi">SMAPE</span>)
    }
    
  <span class="pl-smi">RMSE_mean</span>[<span class="pl-smi">hs</span>] <span class="pl-k">=</span> mean(<span class="pl-smi">RMSEHolder.h</span>)
  <span class="pl-smi">SMAPE_mean</span>[<span class="pl-smi">hs</span>] <span class="pl-k">=</span> mean(<span class="pl-smi">SMAPEHolder.h</span>)
  
  <span class="pl-smi">mlp_df</span>[paste(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>RMSE<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>,toString(<span class="pl-smi">hs</span>), <span class="pl-v">sep</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>_<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>)] <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">RMSE_mean</span>[<span class="pl-smi">hs</span>]
  <span class="pl-smi">mlp_df</span>[paste(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>SMAPE<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>,toString(<span class="pl-smi">hs</span>), <span class="pl-v">sep</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>_<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>)] <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">SMAPE_mean</span>[<span class="pl-smi">hs</span>]  
  
}
<span class="pl-k">return</span>(<span class="pl-v">dataframe</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">mlp_df</span>)
}</pre></div>

<h3 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-mlp-wo-rolling-windows-function-with-step-horizon" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#mlp-wo-rolling-windows-function-with-step-horizon"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>MLP w/o Rolling Windows function with step HORIZON</h3>
<p dir="auto">#####################################################################################</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-r notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="#' This function estimates MLP models without using rolling window for forecast.
#' This function allows the estimation of multiple MLP models. This function also calculates RMSE and SMAPE metrics for time series forecasting. 
#' The function returns a data frame with RMSE and SMAPE values for each horizon values.
#' @param t_series: the Time Series realization
#' @param first_rel: it is an integer indicating the first realization in the list to start with (e.g if you have a total of 438 realization this number will tell what realization to count from up to 438)
#' @param f: frequency of the time series
#' @param horizon: single or list of horizon values to use for forecasting e.g. horizon=4 or horizon=c(2, 5, 10) 

horizon.mlp = function(t_series, f, first_rel, horizon)
{
  
   if (missing(horizon)){horizon = (1:t_series$NF[1])}
    else {horizon = horizon}
  
  if (missing(first_rel)){first_rel = 1:nrow(t_series)}
    else {first_rel = first_rel:nrow(t_series)}
  
  l = length(first_rel)
  lh = length(horizon)
  
  series = list()
  RMSE_MLP = list()
  SMAPE_MLP = list()
  InSampleMSE = list()
  
  RMSEHolder = numeric(length(first_rel))
  SMAPEHolder = numeric(length(first_rel))
  inSampleMSEHolder = numeric(length(first_rel))
  
  empty_matrix = matrix(ncol = 0, nrow =l)
  mlp_df = data.frame(empty_matrix)
  
  for (step_h in horizon) {
      #print(paste(&quot;============================== Computing horizon:&quot;, step_h, '=============================='))
      for (i in first_rel) {
        
        series[[i]] = t_series[i, 1:t_series$N[i]+6]
        series[[i]] = ts(t(series[[i]]), start=c(t_series$`Starting Year`[i], t_series$`Starting Month`[i]), frequency = f)
        horizon = step_h
        
        trainingSize = length(series[[i]])-horizon
        
        set.seed(329)  
        #print(paste('Processing series:', i, ' out of ', dim(t_series)[1]))
        
        fit.m3.mlp = mlp(ts(series[[i]][1:trainingSize], frequency = f),  reps = 20, comb = &quot;mean&quot;)
        forecast.m3.mlp = forecast(fit.m3.mlp, h=horizon)
        
        RMSE = sqrt(mean((series[[i]][(trainingSize+1):(trainingSize+horizon)] - forecast.m3.mlp$mean)^2))
        SMAPE = smape(series[[i]][(trainingSize+1):(trainingSize+horizon)], forecast.m3.mlp$mean)
        
        RMSEHolder[i] = RMSE
        SMAPEHolder[i] = SMAPE
        inSampleMSEHolder[i] = fit.m3.mlp$MSE
      }
  
      rmse_to_df = list(RMSEHolder[sapply(RMSEHolder, function(x) length(x) == 0 )==FALSE])
      smape_to_df = list(SMAPEHolder[sapply(SMAPEHolder, function(x) length(x) == 0 )==FALSE])
      InSampleMSE_df = list(inSampleMSEHolder[sapply(inSampleMSEHolder, function(x) length(x) == 0 )==FALSE])
        
      mlp_df[paste('RMSE',toString(step_h), sep = &quot;_&quot;)] = rmse_to_df
      mlp_df[paste('SMAPE',toString(step_h), sep = &quot;_&quot;)] = smape_to_df  
      }
    return (list(dataframe = mlp_df, InSampleMSE = InSampleMSE_df))
}"><pre><span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span>' This function estimates MLP models without using rolling window for forecast.</span>
<span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span>' This function allows the estimation of multiple MLP models. This function also calculates RMSE and SMAPE metrics for time series forecasting. </span>
<span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span>' The function returns a data frame with RMSE and SMAPE values for each horizon values.</span>
<span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span>' @param t_series: the Time Series realization</span>
<span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span>' @param first_rel: it is an integer indicating the first realization in the list to start with (e.g if you have a total of 438 realization this number will tell what realization to count from up to 438)</span>
<span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span>' @param f: frequency of the time series</span>

{
  
   <span class="pl-k">if</span> (missing(<span class="pl-smi">horizon</span>)){<span class="pl-v">horizon</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> (<span class="pl-c1">1</span><span class="pl-k">:</span><span class="pl-smi">t_series</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">NF</span>[<span class="pl-c1">1</span>])}

    <span class="pl-k">else</span> {<span class="pl-v">first_rel</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">first_rel</span><span class="pl-k">:</span>nrow(<span class="pl-smi">t_series</span>)}
  
  <span class="pl-v">l</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> length(<span class="pl-smi">first_rel</span>)
  <span class="pl-v">lh</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> length(<span class="pl-smi">horizon</span>)
  
  <span class="pl-v">series</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">list</span>()
  <span class="pl-v">RMSE_MLP</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">list</span>()
  <span class="pl-v">SMAPE_MLP</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">list</span>()
  <span class="pl-v">InSampleMSE</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">list</span>()
  
  <span class="pl-v">RMSEHolder</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">numeric</span>(length(<span class="pl-smi">first_rel</span>))
  <span class="pl-v">SMAPEHolder</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">numeric</span>(length(<span class="pl-smi">first_rel</span>))
  <span class="pl-v">inSampleMSEHolder</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">numeric</span>(length(<span class="pl-smi">first_rel</span>))
  
  <span class="pl-v">empty_matrix</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">matrix</span>(<span class="pl-v">ncol</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-c1">0</span>, <span class="pl-v">nrow</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-smi">l</span>)
  <span class="pl-v">mlp_df</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">data.frame</span>(<span class="pl-smi">empty_matrix</span>)
  
  <span class="pl-k">for</span> (<span class="pl-smi">step_h</span> <span class="pl-k">in</span> <span class="pl-smi">horizon</span>) {
      <span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span>print(paste("============================== Computing horizon:", step_h, '=============================='))</span>
      <span class="pl-k">for</span> (<span class="pl-smi">i</span> <span class="pl-k">in</span> <span class="pl-smi">first_rel</span>) {
        
        <span class="pl-smi">series</span>[[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>]] <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">t_series</span>[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>, <span class="pl-c1">1</span><span class="pl-k">:</span><span class="pl-smi">t_series</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">N</span>[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>]<span class="pl-k">+</span><span class="pl-c1">6</span>]
        <span class="pl-smi">series</span>[[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>]] <span class="pl-k">=</span> ts(t(<span class="pl-smi">series</span>[[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>]]), <span class="pl-v">start</span><span class="pl-k">=</span>c(<span class="pl-smi">t_series</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">`Starting Year`</span>[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>], <span class="pl-smi">t_series</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">`Starting Month`</span>[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>]), <span class="pl-v">frequency</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">f</span>)
        <span class="pl-v">horizon</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">step_h</span>
        
        <span class="pl-v">trainingSize</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> length(<span class="pl-smi">series</span>[[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>]])<span class="pl-k">-</span><span class="pl-smi">horizon</span>
        
        set.seed(<span class="pl-c1">329</span>)  
        <span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span>print(paste('Processing series:', i, ' out of ', dim(t_series)[1]))</span>
        
        <span class="pl-v">fit.m3.mlp</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> mlp(ts(<span class="pl-smi">series</span>[[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>]][<span class="pl-c1">1</span><span class="pl-k">:</span><span class="pl-smi">trainingSize</span>], <span class="pl-v">frequency</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">f</span>),  <span class="pl-v">reps</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-c1">20</span>, <span class="pl-v">comb</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>mean<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>)

        <span class="pl-smi">RMSEHolder</span>[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>] <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">RMSE</span>
        <span class="pl-smi">SMAPEHolder</span>[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>] <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">SMAPE</span>
        <span class="pl-smi">inSampleMSEHolder</span>[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>] <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">fit.m3.mlp</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">MSE</span>
      }
  
      <span class="pl-v">rmse_to_df</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">list</span>(<span class="pl-smi">RMSEHolder</span>[sapply(<span class="pl-smi">RMSEHolder</span>, <span class="pl-k">function</span>(<span class="pl-smi">x</span>) length(<span class="pl-smi">x</span>) <span class="pl-k">==</span> <span class="pl-c1">0</span> )<span class="pl-k">==</span><span class="pl-c1">FALSE</span>])
      <span class="pl-v">smape_to_df</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">list</span>(<span class="pl-smi">SMAPEHolder</span>[sapply(<span class="pl-smi">SMAPEHolder</span>, <span class="pl-k">function</span>(<span class="pl-smi">x</span>) length(<span class="pl-smi">x</span>) <span class="pl-k">==</span> <span class="pl-c1">0</span> )<span class="pl-k">==</span><span class="pl-c1">FALSE</span>])
      <span class="pl-v">InSampleMSE_df</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">list</span>(<span class="pl-smi">inSampleMSEHolder</span>[sapply(<span class="pl-smi">inSampleMSEHolder</span>, <span class="pl-k">function</span>(<span class="pl-smi">x</span>) length(<span class="pl-smi">x</span>) <span class="pl-k">==</span> <span class="pl-c1">0</span> )<span class="pl-k">==</span><span class="pl-c1">FALSE</span>])
        
      <span class="pl-smi">mlp_df</span>[paste(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>RMSE<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>,toString(<span class="pl-smi">step_h</span>), <span class="pl-v">sep</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>_<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>)] <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">rmse_to_df</span>
      <span class="pl-smi">mlp_df</span>[paste(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>SMAPE<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>,toString(<span class="pl-smi">step_h</span>), <span class="pl-v">sep</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>_<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>)] <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">smape_to_df</span>  
      }
    <span class="pl-k">return</span> (<span class="pl-k">list</span>(<span class="pl-v">dataframe</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">mlp_df</span>, <span class="pl-v">InSampleMSE</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">InSampleMSE_df</span>))
}</pre></div>

<h3 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-data-preparation-function-for-visualization" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#data-preparation-function-for-visualization"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>Data Preparation function for visualization</h3>
<p dir="auto">#####################################################################################</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-r notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="#' This function prepares the data for comparative visualization.
#' This function transforms the data to long format to enable easier visualization of multiple factors on a single plot. 
#' The function returns the transformed data frames with RMSE and SMAPE values for each horizon values.
#' @param arima_results: data frame with RMSE and SMAPE results from an ARIMA/ARMA model.
#' @param mlp_results: data frame with RMSE and SMAPE results from an MLP model.
#' @param type: RMSE or SMAPE 
#' @param log_trn: Boolean (TRUE/FALSE). Default is FALSE. This argument enables log transformation of the output data frame values in case outliers would distort the visualization too much. 

dataprep = function(arima_results, mlp_results, type, log_trn = FALSE)
{
  type = toupper(type)
  
  ######### ARIMA ##########
  dfa = arima_results
  dfa_unlist = data.frame(lapply(dfa, function(x) unlist(x)))
  col_list_a = colnames(dfa_unlist)[grepl(type,colnames(dfa_unlist))]
  dfa_a = dfa_unlist[,col_list_a]
  seq_max_a = dim(dfa_a)[1]
  dfa_a['x'] = seq(1,seq_max_a,1)
  
  dfa = reshape2::melt(dfa_a ,  id.vars = 'x', variable.name = 'Horizon_ARIMA')
  
  if (log_trn == TRUE){dfa$value = log(dfa$value)}
  
  ######### MLP ##########
  dfm = mlp_results
  dfm_unlist = data.frame(lapply(dfm, function(x) unlist(x)))
  col_list_m = colnames(dfm_unlist)[grepl(type,colnames(dfm_unlist))]
  dfm_m = dfm_unlist[,col_list_m]
  seq_max_m = dim(dfm_m)[1]
  dfm_m['x'] = seq(1,seq_max_m,1)
  
  dfm = reshape2::melt(dfm_m ,  id.vars = 'x', variable.name = 'Horizon_MLP')
  
  if (log_trn == TRUE){dfm$value = log(dfm$value)}
  
  return (list(dfa = dfa, dfm = dfm))
}"><pre><span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span>' This function prepares the data for comparative visualization.</span>
<span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span>' This function transforms the data to long format to enable easier visualization of multiple factors on a single plot. </span>
<span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span>' The function returns the transformed data frames with RMSE and SMAPE values for each horizon values.</span>
<span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span>' @param arima_results: data frame with RMSE and SMAPE results from an ARIMA/ARMA model.</span>
<span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span>' @param mlp_results: data frame with RMSE and SMAPE results from an MLP model.</span>
<span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span>' @param type: RMSE or SMAPE </span>
<span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span>' @param log_trn: Boolean (TRUE/FALSE). Default is FALSE. This argument enables log transformation of the output data frame values in case outliers would distort the visualization too much. </span>

<span class="pl-en">dataprep</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">function</span>(<span class="pl-smi">arima_results</span>, <span class="pl-smi">mlp_results</span>, <span class="pl-smi">type</span>, <span class="pl-v">log_trn</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-c1">FALSE</span>)
{
  <span class="pl-v">type</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> toupper(<span class="pl-smi">type</span>)
  
  <span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span>######## ARIMA ##########</span>
  <span class="pl-v">dfa</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">arima_results</span>
  <span class="pl-v">dfa_unlist</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">data.frame</span>(lapply(<span class="pl-smi">dfa</span>, <span class="pl-k">function</span>(<span class="pl-smi">x</span>) unlist(<span class="pl-smi">x</span>)))
  <span class="pl-v">col_list_a</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> colnames(<span class="pl-smi">dfa_unlist</span>)[grepl(<span class="pl-smi">type</span>,colnames(<span class="pl-smi">dfa_unlist</span>))]
  <span class="pl-v">dfa_a</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">dfa_unlist</span>[,<span class="pl-smi">col_list_a</span>]
  <span class="pl-v">seq_max_a</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> dim(<span class="pl-smi">dfa_a</span>)[<span class="pl-c1">1</span>]
  <span class="pl-smi">dfa_a</span>[<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>x<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>] <span class="pl-k">=</span> seq(<span class="pl-c1">1</span>,<span class="pl-smi">seq_max_a</span>,<span class="pl-c1">1</span>)
  
  <span class="pl-v">dfa</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-e">reshape2</span><span class="pl-k">::</span>melt(<span class="pl-smi">dfa_a</span> ,  <span class="pl-v">id.vars</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>x<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>, <span class="pl-v">variable.name</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>Horizon_ARIMA<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>)
  
  <span class="pl-k">if</span> (<span class="pl-smi">log_trn</span> <span class="pl-k">==</span> <span class="pl-c1">TRUE</span>){<span class="pl-smi">dfa</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-v">value</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> log(<span class="pl-smi">dfa</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">value</span>)}
  
  <span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span>######## MLP ##########</span>
  <span class="pl-v">dfm</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">mlp_results</span>
  <span class="pl-v">dfm_unlist</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">data.frame</span>(lapply(<span class="pl-smi">dfm</span>, <span class="pl-k">function</span>(<span class="pl-smi">x</span>) unlist(<span class="pl-smi">x</span>)))
  <span class="pl-v">col_list_m</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> colnames(<span class="pl-smi">dfm_unlist</span>)[grepl(<span class="pl-smi">type</span>,colnames(<span class="pl-smi">dfm_unlist</span>))]
  <span class="pl-v">dfm_m</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">dfm_unlist</span>[,<span class="pl-smi">col_list_m</span>]
  <span class="pl-v">seq_max_m</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> dim(<span class="pl-smi">dfm_m</span>)[<span class="pl-c1">1</span>]
  <span class="pl-smi">dfm_m</span>[<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>x<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>] <span class="pl-k">=</span> seq(<span class="pl-c1">1</span>,<span class="pl-smi">seq_max_m</span>,<span class="pl-c1">1</span>)
  
  <span class="pl-v">dfm</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-e">reshape2</span><span class="pl-k">::</span>melt(<span class="pl-smi">dfm_m</span> ,  <span class="pl-v">id.vars</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>x<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>, <span class="pl-v">variable.name</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>Horizon_MLP<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>)
  
  <span class="pl-k">if</span> (<span class="pl-smi">log_trn</span> <span class="pl-k">==</span> <span class="pl-c1">TRUE</span>){<span class="pl-smi">dfm</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-v">value</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> log(<span class="pl-smi">dfm</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">value</span>)}
  
  <span class="pl-k">return</span> (<span class="pl-k">list</span>(<span class="pl-v">dfa</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">dfa</span>, <span class="pl-v">dfm</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">dfm</span>))
}</pre></div>

<h3 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-data-preparation-function-for-ensemble-approach-visualization" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#data-preparation-function-for-ensemble-approach-visualization"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>Data Preparation function for Ensemble approach visualization</h3>
<p dir="auto">#####################################################################################</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-r notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="#' This function prepares the data for comparative visualization for the ensemble method.
#' This function transforms the data to long format to enable easier visualization of multiple factors on a single plot. 
#' The function returns the transformed data frames with RMSE and SMAPE values for each horizon values.
#' @param arima_results: data frame with RMSE and SMAPE results from an ARIMA/ARMA model.
#' @param mlp_results: data frame with RMSE and SMAPE results from an MLP model.
#' @param type: RMSE or SMAPE 

e_dataprep = function(arima_results, mlp_results, type)
{
  type = toupper(type)
  
  ######### ARIMA ##########
  dfa = arima_results
  dfa_unlist = data.frame(lapply(dfa, function(x) unlist(x)))
  col_list_a = colnames(dfa_unlist)[grepl(type,colnames(dfa_unlist))]
  dfa_a = dfa_unlist[,col_list_a]
  seq_max_a = dim(dfa_a)[2]
  dfa = reshape2::melt(dfa_a, id.vars = NULL, variable.name = 'Horizon_ARIMA')
  dfa['MODEL'] = 'ARIMA'
  dfa['x'] = seq(1,seq_max_a,1)
  
  ######### MLP ##########
  dfm = mlp_results
  dfm_unlist = data.frame(lapply(dfm, function(x) unlist(x)))
  col_list_m = colnames(dfm_unlist)[grepl(type,colnames(dfm_unlist))]
  dfm_m = dfm_unlist[,col_list_m]
  seq_max_m = dim(dfm_m)[2]
  dfm = reshape2::melt(dfm_m,  id.vars = NULL, variable.name = 'Horizon_MLP')
  dfm['MODEL'] = 'MLP'
  dfm['x'] = seq(1,seq_max_m,1)
  
  return (list(dfa = dfa, dfm = dfm))
}"><pre><span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span>' This function prepares the data for comparative visualization for the ensemble method.</span>
<span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span>' This function transforms the data to long format to enable easier visualization of multiple factors on a single plot. </span>
<span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span>' The function returns the transformed data frames with RMSE and SMAPE values for each horizon values.</span>
<span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span>' @param arima_results: data frame with RMSE and SMAPE results from an ARIMA/ARMA model.</span>
<span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span>' @param mlp_results: data frame with RMSE and SMAPE results from an MLP model.</span>
<span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span>' @param type: RMSE or SMAPE </span>

<span class="pl-en">e_dataprep</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">function</span>(<span class="pl-smi">arima_results</span>, <span class="pl-smi">mlp_results</span>, <span class="pl-smi">type</span>)
{
  <span class="pl-v">type</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> toupper(<span class="pl-smi">type</span>)
  
  <span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span>######## ARIMA ##########</span>
  <span class="pl-v">dfa</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">arima_results</span>
  <span class="pl-v">dfa_unlist</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">data.frame</span>(lapply(<span class="pl-smi">dfa</span>, <span class="pl-k">function</span>(<span class="pl-smi">x</span>) unlist(<span class="pl-smi">x</span>)))
  <span class="pl-v">col_list_a</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> colnames(<span class="pl-smi">dfa_unlist</span>)[grepl(<span class="pl-smi">type</span>,colnames(<span class="pl-smi">dfa_unlist</span>))]
  <span class="pl-v">dfa_a</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">dfa_unlist</span>[,<span class="pl-smi">col_list_a</span>]
  <span class="pl-v">seq_max_a</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> dim(<span class="pl-smi">dfa_a</span>)[<span class="pl-c1">2</span>]
  <span class="pl-v">dfa</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-e">reshape2</span><span class="pl-k">::</span>melt(<span class="pl-smi">dfa_a</span>, <span class="pl-v">id.vars</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-c1">NULL</span>, <span class="pl-v">variable.name</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>Horizon_ARIMA<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>)
  <span class="pl-smi">dfa</span>[<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>MODEL<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>] <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>ARIMA<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>
  <span class="pl-smi">dfa</span>[<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>x<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>] <span class="pl-k">=</span> seq(<span class="pl-c1">1</span>,<span class="pl-smi">seq_max_a</span>,<span class="pl-c1">1</span>)
  
  <span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span>######## MLP ##########</span>
  <span class="pl-v">dfm</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">mlp_results</span>
  <span class="pl-v">dfm_unlist</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">data.frame</span>(lapply(<span class="pl-smi">dfm</span>, <span class="pl-k">function</span>(<span class="pl-smi">x</span>) unlist(<span class="pl-smi">x</span>)))
  <span class="pl-v">col_list_m</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> colnames(<span class="pl-smi">dfm_unlist</span>)[grepl(<span class="pl-smi">type</span>,colnames(<span class="pl-smi">dfm_unlist</span>))]
  <span class="pl-v">dfm_m</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">dfm_unlist</span>[,<span class="pl-smi">col_list_m</span>]
  <span class="pl-v">seq_max_m</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> dim(<span class="pl-smi">dfm_m</span>)[<span class="pl-c1">2</span>]
  <span class="pl-v">dfm</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-e">reshape2</span><span class="pl-k">::</span>melt(<span class="pl-smi">dfm_m</span>,  <span class="pl-v">id.vars</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-c1">NULL</span>, <span class="pl-v">variable.name</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>Horizon_MLP<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>)
  <span class="pl-smi">dfm</span>[<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>MODEL<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>] <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>MLP<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>
  <span class="pl-smi">dfm</span>[<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>x<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>] <span class="pl-k">=</span> seq(<span class="pl-c1">1</span>,<span class="pl-smi">seq_max_m</span>,<span class="pl-c1">1</span>)
  
  <span class="pl-k">return</span> (<span class="pl-k">list</span>(<span class="pl-v">dfa</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">dfa</span>, <span class="pl-v">dfm</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">dfm</span>))
}</pre></div>

<h3 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-visualization-function" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#visualization-function"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>Visualization function</h3>
<p dir="auto">#####################################################################################</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-r notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="#' This function generates a comprehensive plot with all the time series forecast RMSE or SMAPE values. 
#' @param dfa: ARIMA/ARMA data frame generated by the `dataprep()` function as an output.
#' @param dfm: MLP data frame generated by the `dataprep()` function as an output.
#' @param type: RMSE or SMAPE
#' @param period: Time interval of the realization. Could take values: 'M' - Monthly data; 'Q' - Quarterly data; 'Y' - Yearly data  

visualize = function(dfa, dfm, type, period)
{ 
  y_label = toupper(type)
  period = toupper(period)
  type=toupper(paste(type,'_',sep=''))
  a_horizon_labels = unique(dfa$Horizon_ARIMA)
  dfah = as.numeric(gsub(type, &quot;&quot;, a_horizon_labels))
  
  m_horizon_labels = unique(dfm$Horizon_MLP)
  dfmh = as.numeric(gsub(type, &quot;&quot;, m_horizon_labels))
  
  line_type_value = rep(&quot;dashed&quot;, length(dfmh))
  
  if (period == 'M') {period = 'Monthly data'}
    else if (period == 'Q') {period = 'Quarterly Data'}
    else if (period == 'Y') {period = 'Yearly Data'}
  
  
  # Plot RMSE or SMAPE
  ggplot(NULL, aes(x, value)) +
    geom_line(data = dfa, mapping = aes(color = Horizon_ARIMA)) +
    geom_line(data = dfm, mapping = aes(group = Horizon_MLP, color = Horizon_MLP, linetype = Horizon_MLP)) +
    geom_point(data = dfa, mapping = aes(color = Horizon_ARIMA))+
    #geom_point(data = dfm, mapping = aes(color = Horizon_MLP))+
    scale_color_discrete(name = &quot;ARIMA Forecast horizon&quot;,
                         breaks = unique(dfa$Horizon_ARIMA),
                         labels = dfah) +
    scale_linetype_manual(name = &quot;MLP Forecast horizon&quot;,
                         breaks = unique(dfm$Horizon_MLP),
                         labels = dfmh,
                         values=line_type_value)+
    xlab(&quot;# of models&quot;) + 
    ylab(y_label) +
    labs(title=&quot;ARIMA vs MLP model performance&quot;,
         subtitle = period) +
    theme(plot.title=element_text(hjust=0.5),
          plot.subtitle = element_text(hjust=0.5))
}"><pre><span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span>' This function generates a comprehensive plot with all the time series forecast RMSE or SMAPE values. </span>
<span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span>' @param dfa: ARIMA/ARMA data frame generated by the `dataprep()` function as an output.</span>

<span class="pl-en">visualize</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">function</span>(<span class="pl-smi">dfa</span>, <span class="pl-smi">dfm</span>, <span class="pl-smi">type</span>, <span class="pl-smi">period</span>)

  <span class="pl-v">a_horizon_labels</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> unique(<span class="pl-smi">dfa</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">Horizon_ARIMA</span>)
  <span class="pl-v">dfah</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> as.numeric(gsub(<span class="pl-smi">type</span>, <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span><span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, <span class="pl-smi">a_horizon_labels</span>))
  
  <span class="pl-v">m_horizon_labels</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> unique(<span class="pl-smi">dfm</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">Horizon_MLP</span>)
  <span class="pl-v">dfmh</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> as.numeric(gsub(<span class="pl-smi">type</span>, <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span><span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, <span class="pl-smi">m_horizon_labels</span>))
  
  <span class="pl-v">line_type_value</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> rep(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>dashed<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, length(<span class="pl-smi">dfmh</span>))
  
  <span class="pl-k">if</span> (<span class="pl-smi">period</span> <span class="pl-k">==</span> <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>M<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>) {<span class="pl-v">period</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>Monthly data<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>}
    <span class="pl-k">else</span> <span class="pl-k">if</span> (<span class="pl-smi">period</span> <span class="pl-k">==</span> <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>Q<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>) {<span class="pl-v">period</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>Quarterly Data<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>}
    <span class="pl-k">else</span> <span class="pl-k">if</span> (<span class="pl-smi">period</span> <span class="pl-k">==</span> <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>Y<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>) {<span class="pl-v">period</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>Yearly Data<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>}
  
  
  <span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span> Plot RMSE or SMAPE</span>
  ggplot(<span class="pl-c1">NULL</span>, aes(<span class="pl-smi">x</span>, <span class="pl-smi">value</span>)) <span class="pl-k">+</span>
    geom_line(<span class="pl-v">data</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">dfa</span>, <span class="pl-v">mapping</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> aes(<span class="pl-v">color</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">Horizon_ARIMA</span>)) <span class="pl-k">+</span>
    geom_line(<span class="pl-v">data</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">dfm</span>, <span class="pl-v">mapping</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> aes(<span class="pl-v">group</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">Horizon_MLP</span>, <span class="pl-v">color</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">Horizon_MLP</span>, <span class="pl-v">linetype</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">Horizon_MLP</span>)) <span class="pl-k">+</span>
    geom_point(<span class="pl-v">data</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">dfa</span>, <span class="pl-v">mapping</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> aes(<span class="pl-v">color</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">Horizon_ARIMA</span>))<span class="pl-k">+</span>
    <span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span>geom_point(data = dfm, mapping = aes(color = Horizon_MLP))+</span>
    scale_color_discrete(<span class="pl-v">name</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>ARIMA Forecast horizon<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>,
                         <span class="pl-v">breaks</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> unique(<span class="pl-smi">dfa</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">Horizon_ARIMA</span>),
                         <span class="pl-v">labels</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">dfah</span>) <span class="pl-k">+</span>
    scale_linetype_manual(<span class="pl-v">name</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>MLP Forecast horizon<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>,
                         <span class="pl-v">breaks</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> unique(<span class="pl-smi">dfm</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">Horizon_MLP</span>),
                         <span class="pl-v">labels</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">dfmh</span>,
                         <span class="pl-v">values</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-smi">line_type_value</span>)<span class="pl-k">+</span>
    xlab(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span># of models<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>) <span class="pl-k">+</span> 
    ylab(<span class="pl-smi">y_label</span>) <span class="pl-k">+</span>
    labs(<span class="pl-v">title</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>ARIMA vs MLP model performance<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>,
         <span class="pl-v">subtitle</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">period</span>) <span class="pl-k">+</span>
    theme(<span class="pl-v">plot.title</span><span class="pl-k">=</span>element_text(<span class="pl-v">hjust</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">0.5</span>),
          <span class="pl-v">plot.subtitle</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> element_text(<span class="pl-v">hjust</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">0.5</span>))
